Genghis Grill is an ok place. The place is nice and like the idea of being able to customize your bowl the way you want. They give you so many meats, sauces, seasonings and vegetables to choose from you'll never run out of creative ways to make your bowl. Plus for the lazy person, they have bowls already created so you don't have to decide if choice is hard for ya lol. The biggest drawback is PRICE!! Average $10 for a bowl. The scary part is you can pile up so much ingredients and have it overflowing with goodness and BOOM!! When its cooked your bowl has shrunk lol. I was like what the hell? Did they drop half my food on the floor? Especially for the money. If your craving Mongolian, you can find better deals elsewhere. At the Fiesta Henderson Buffet, they have a mongolian section and you can customize your plate anyway you want for half the price and as the Fat Boys Song says, "All You Can" Eat!!" Until next time, Let's Eat!!!

This is my fourth time back with my husband and kids and I must say that every visit has been such a pleasure. Our server Taylor is the reason we keep returning. The food speaks for itself great taste great quality but your dining experience relies on the customer service. When your waiter or waitress not only knows you by name but can remember what you like to eat and what appetizers you previously tried that is what going above and beyond stands for. I love the dining experience and atmosphere . Tonight I got to enjoy football great prices and felt like I was fine dining . I truly hope someone recognizes when your staff goes above and beyond excellence to ensure the customers are given a great dining experience . From the attentiveness to the hot meal you created this place feels like home. Just an fyi I did read a previous statement by a customers complaining about Taylor and I beg to differ.. If the staff asks if you have been there before it's because they want to ensure that your experience will be a memorable one. When your waiter asks if everything is alright or do you enjoy the food it's because they really want your opinion to make sure you are enjoying what you are paying for . Seems to me like this girl should have stayed home . Overall u get your money's worth your kids are entertained with the games a great place to take your family for a healty dinner .. Please ask for Taylor to serve you she will bring a smile to your face

I think this is a great place. I like the whole concept behind it. Pick out what you want and can cram into a bowl and they cook it up for you. So many different combinations. Yes. Sometimes the food line can get a little messy if they are busy. This location seems to do a good job of keeping it clean and tidy. It is pretty easy. They give you your bowl when they seat you then you go to the food line and pick out everything you want. They also have recipes if you just can't decide what would go good together. Start out with the meat. They have steak, pork, chicken, sausage, crab, etc. Then you move on to spices and whatever veggies you want. You finish up with sauces. All different kinds. They have little metal cups for the sauces and you can get as much as you want of everything. You take your bowl and sauces over to the cooks and let them know what kind of starch you would like. They have several different kinds, udon noddles, white rice, fried rice, egg noddles and a few others. They give you a number and you go back to your table and put the card in the holder. When your bowl is done they bring it right to your table. They do provide forks if you just can't handle chopsticks. They also have a few apps like edamame and potstickers.  I love potstickers and theirs are pretty good. They also have $1 domestic beers. Tough to beat that. This may not be the best place in the world but it is pretty good. It is kind of your own fault if it is not good since you put it together but there is the possibility the ingredients were not fresh or something. But every time that I have been here there has never been a problem. I will continue to go back once in a while.

very nice..used to go to BD Mongolian all the time...but none in Vegas. *Womp Womp" Me and the wife tried Genghis Grill. Just like what I was used to. Food turned out good. At the time I wasn't impressed with the service. However I was told later the delays were related to a fund raiser for a school that was taking place. So I will have to go back soon. Food was good!! $3 more for unlimited eats!!!

The food quality was excellent as usual. I like Genghis SO much better than YC's because of the freshness of the meat.  At YC's it's always frozen.  While it's kind of gross to see raw meat out, it is always kept cold and is much better than the frozen meats at YCs.  This restaurant hasn't been in this location very long. It used to be a My Big Fat Greek Restaurant. I am glad to see that there is a Genghis Grill close to my location. However in this new location, it seems that they need to improve on some things. The atmosphere wasn't great nor did it do anything great for the experience.  They have several flat screen tv's and the music was quite loud.  It was almost too loud for a restaurant atmosphere.  There was a considerable wait for the server to come with our beverages and then consistently over the course of our meal, our server was rarely seen and quite slow.   After we received our beverages but before we went through the line, we saw a large roach crawling on the floor next to our table.  My husband told another server who took care of the problem and then told the manager. It took a little while for me to get my appetite back but once I did we proceeded quickly through the line.  The line, again had great food albeit a bit messy and the handles on the spoons for serving the food were sticky.  After our meal, it took a very long time to get the check. We first requested it from the manager and then from another server than our own and then finally from the manager again.  It was almost 15 minutes before we received it.  While the food was good, I was disappointed with the service and atmosphere.  I really like Genghis and want it to be good.  The location at Tempe Marketplace is better for cleanliness and service.

Whenever my Wife and I can't decide on where to go for lunch, we go to Genghis Grill, because it is like no other place around here. You know what you're eating as you fill up your bowl, and our waiter John is a "ROCKSTAR". This awesome guy always has a smile on his face, and a 'can do' attitude, as in "what else can I do for you" We love this place!

I love this place. It's so fun to make your own bowl and then watch it get cooked!  It's the best to get the udon noodles and tortillas! Mmmmm!  The staff here was always awesome.  I totally recommend this place!

Our food was so good and fun to make! It's refreshing to go somewhere and be able to make your food just how you want it. Our server Caroline was very attentive and very lively. She made it very comfortable atmosphere I would 100% go back and eat there again and would definitely recommend it to my friends !!!!!

There is a lot of variety on the line. I selected shrimp, veggies, brown rice and a spicy ginger sauce. This is my first time here and the staff were patient in explaining the jig. The price was 13.49, for a medium bowl - however it looked very small to me and when I did get my meal it looked so small. Now I understand the seasoned customer in front of me who packed her veggies and meats with her fingers. Initially I was annoyed by her taking so long, now, I completely understand. The staff cooked my meal but I will take credit for putting it together. If I come back but will pack my food into my silver bowl like she did. I was there for lunch, music was too loud and just made me feel anxious so I left. I couldn't eat my food comfortably.

O M G!!! This place is my new favorite. For $15, I ate probably 3 pounds of deliciousness! From the moment I entered this place to the moment I left, I was impressed. I had multiple employees help me with the process and ask me how my meal was. You have so many options, it was nice to get advice from the employees. I will be back again and again and again!!!

I was really disappointed.  I went with my husband and our 5 year old daughter before we went to see a movie, at first i was pleased, the hostess handed us a tiny bowl for our daughter and seated us right away.  from there it was horrible.  She tossed a menu down on the table and walked away, and me being used to Mongolian like at YC's this was way different.  I had to stop another employee to ask what we were supposed to do. he waved us over to the line where the food was and walked off.  I walked up and saw all the choices for meat, it didn't look like they kept it cold enough so i steered clear of any seafood and anything not marinated.  The vegetables mostly looked canned except for the mushrooms and the carrots.  The guys at the grill weren't happy to be there and they made no point of hiding that fact, they just pointed at our choices (rice, brown rice, udon noodles, or SERIOUSLY spiral macaroni) and grunted something, he handed us three cards and sent us off, by the time we got back to our table they had seated someone else at our table.  I was so upset I almost walked out at this point, but we didn't have time for anything else before the movie.  I would definitely NOT recommend this to ANYONE, all the food tasted horrible, go to YC's instead.

It's a chain, so I'm never really all that excited about chains.  But it's good for what it is.  The service is always prompt, friendly and not overbearing.  As for the food, it's the usual Mongolian BBQ type set up, you fill your bowl with protein and veggies and then hand that off to the guys cooking on the grill, and tell them what starch you want to add.  Nothing fancy, but you can get a good meal, and if you're trying to eat healthy, you can do it pretty easily here if that's your bag. It's about $10 a person, so not a great deal, but not too pricey either.

Why 2 stars? Because it's one of the worst meals I've had in a long time.     ---   ---   ---  I used to eat at a local Mongolian grill very often in high school, and I was pretty excited to be reunited with one during my layover in Charlotte.  I can excuse the fact that my order was forgotten, and I had to wait much longer than everyone else around me... mistakes happen. What I cannot understand is how they can, in good conscience, serve the Mongo BBQ bowl. Honestly, it's one of the worst tasting things I have had in a very long time.  I can't imagine the President of Genghis Grill visiting this location, tasting this dish, and saying, "yep... that's the Genghis way!"  I mean, it was just awful. Even if I don't like something, I usually end up finishing the whole thing, because I'm a human garbage can... but I couldn't stomach finishing this.

This place is seriously one of my favorite places to eat. The staff is always friendly and talkative. The mongolian bbq sauce is easily the best thing about their food. I just wish I were a little thinner and wealthier so I could eat it more often.

Food is good but you can't really give that to them since you decide what it tastes like based on what you pick.   The prices to serving sizes here are a total joke. Ordered a small, 11.88 after tax, plus this is a service restaurant so add tip (or don't). I just finished my meal, I'm out 12.88 and still hungry as hell. A large will set you back 15$ and isn't as big as YCs small that only cost 8.95. Plus you get free soft serve at YC! Won't be back

We haven't been here in over a year and decided to try it again. Unfortunately it failed because of cleanliness. When we walked in we noticed a lot of dirt on the floor. The bar area floor was very dirty.  This was at 11:30 on a Sunday morning so obviously left over from the night before. The booth they tried to seat us at had dirt and food on the seats and table which we asked them to clean before we sat down.  When we went to get food the entire area was dirty and based on the number of customers in the restaurant looked like it had been left from the night before. The cooler doors on the inside of the food area had drips of food all over them. This is just a mass case of food poisoning waiting to happen. Bathrooms floors were nasty. The sink was falling off the wall. The plastic trash bag inside the feminine product disposal was so large it touched you when you used the toilet. The health department needs to visit

Great food for an airport. The concept is a fixed menu of 8-10 "bowls" with a choice of meat, veg (including veggie), starch (brown rice, white rice, noodles), and styles (eg teriyaki, korean, mongolian) . You order, pay your $8-10, then they cook it right in front of you. So you get FRESH food for about what you would pay for steamtable fare anywhere else.  Plus it's actually good ! We need more of these in more airports.  Together with the sushi joint right next door, this makes the Charlotte Airport  a really nice place to transfer thru. Very strong work.

Nice to have a vegetarian option (other than salad) when traveling.  Ordered the Bhuda Bowl.  Not totally a fan of the mix of vegetables (green beans, but no onions?) but it was still tasty over the noodles with a Siracha sauce and a bit of soy sauce on it.    Asahi beer?  Yes please.    Order taker was very friendly.  Food was quick.

We asked for something off menu and voila out it came--chicken philly--so good, hot, perfectly grilled vegetables. French fries crispy and seasoned well. Not a fan of the special sauce, but it was on the side. I'd come back.

This restaurant definitely gives me hope that Mongolian Grill restaurants can still dish out great food. This restaurant in particular is on point with the service and attitude and the food and ingredients are amazing.

Pleasantly surprised and I trigger moreso than I expected. It's a step above Mongolian BBQ that I've had in the past. The selections are quite vast and the wide array of vegetables are super fresh. It's a yummy yet healthy option and filling for 10.99. $3 more and your bowl is bottomless but honestly I eat a ton and one bowl is good enough.   Pile the veggies up high and don't be shy; they do cook down!

Just okay for my taste, the one thing I do like is that you can go crazy with what you decide you want to have them cook up for ya!!  You simply, pick your choice of meat, choice of seasoning, veggies, sauce and starch and you hand it over to the cook, that then they heat it up for you in their gigantic grill and TA DA, it is all ready for you to enjoy!! The one thing that I honestly don't really like is the price, it could definitely be adjusted, it is a bit over-priced for the portioned you get and that is without a drink, if they included your drink of choice then I would then be content!!

Came here for dinner. When you enter, they ask if you've been there before and if not a waiter takes you to the line and explains it to you. Its a different process for a sit down place. We chose our size bowl, piled on veggies and meat and chose what sauce we wanted, and there's quite a few choices for each section, thats nice. Bring it to the cooks and asked if we wanted an egg and either rice, noodles, or half and half. The noodles weren't like regular mongolian noodles you usually get from these types of places, they were like udon noodles, i think, which was weird to me. They cook it and then the waiter brings it to your table. It was not bad, but also not great. It was hella pricey though. For a medium bowl it was like 10-11$ for dinner. I never pay that much for mongolian noodles esp for that amount of food. The waitress we had was super nice and always checked up on us so the service overall at the place was great. It wasn't busy when we went during a weekday, and there's plenty of room, it's quite big actually with large tvs hanging around. Booths or tables available. Would only come back if i was really craving some noodles real quick bc it's nearby.
Things have changed at this location, I usually enjoy shrimp , crab and calamari and they had none of that. I will not visit this location again when visiting Scottsdale like we usually do.

This place looks like it should get four or five stars. Unfortunately, it didn't deliver a four or five star experience.  We went there on a Sunday for lunch. We walked in and just managed to get in the door. There were several people in front of us waiting for a table. The hostess seated everyone fairly quick. We were taken to be seated at a table, but doing so would have put us shoulder-to-shoulder and elbow-to-elbow with the people at the tables next to us. The inside, at least for me, felt claustrophobic. (I don't think I've been anywhere that felt this way before.) We decided instead to sit at the bar.  We took a seat at the bar. The bar is small. Maybe a little bigger than what someone might have in their home. We were promptly greeted by the bartender. She took our drink order and gave us a quick run down of how to get our food. There is a menu  but you have to go to almost the last page to get bowl sizes and price.  You have a couple options to get your food. One is to fill out a small card with your name, bowl size and if you want noodles, rice or cabbage added to what you already put in your bowl. This you take with you, get in line, fill your bowl with your choices and present it at the end to the cooks. Or, you can fill out a larger card that lists all your options for ingredients, check off what you want and hand it to your server to take up for you. As a third option, there are twelve dishes listed with ingredients if you prefer to not have to wing it.  We decided to make our own. Line was short and moved quickly. First station you pick your meat. Although shrimp is still on the menu, they are no longer serving it due to cost. I picked the lime garlic fish instead. Next is seasoning, after that veggies and last is sauces. You can also add an egg at the end. Then mark if you want noodles, rice or cabbage and off it goes to be cooked. There are a lot of choices. It's a bit overwhelming at first.   We went back and sat down. Our food was done fairly quick. The food looked good, but somehow I think my fish got lost. At first I thought it may have flaked apart, but I never even found flakes of it. Quite disappointing! First no shrimp, even though still on the menu, and then my fish was completely left out.  By the time we finished, the line for a bowl had become increasingly longer. The odd thing is that the line itself cuts right through the middle of the restaurant and towards the front door, further lending to the small claustrophobic feel.   Service was good, food just okay, atmosphere was close and too small.  Two stars.
Not bad. Remember YC's being better.

I'm not a "yelper" at all but I am a server in a fine dining steakhouse on the strip so I know and appreciate good service when I get it and I always get it here. My Son and I make the drive across town for the food and have become regulars bcuz of how amazing it is. We've taken a liking to Tayler as she is always sweet and welcoming and goes out of her way to chat with my son about his baseball games, she's efficient and always makes sure we have everything we need. The time or two we didn't sit with her she made it a point to stop by and say hello. Amazing food..Amazing staff! Pineapple cake a must try!!!!

First time eating at this location, and the workers were very friendly and inviting. Food was good, I wouldn't given it a 5 star but I asked for for fried rice instead of steam rice, but in all it was still good
For a stir fry "your way", Genghis is the way to go! Good, fresh, quality ingredients to make your lunch or dinner exactly the way you want it! Great service also!

This place is phenomenal!  The food and sauce choices are expansive and the guides to creating a delicious meal are great. The concept is different than whats offered in Ballantyne and the staff is patient to give customers a tutorial in how to make a great meal. Be fun, be creative and try some new combos because you cannot go wrong! Improvements can definitely be made for the service. Often when I go, my water glass is empty and the servers seem disinterested to take care of their tables. It's one of those rare places where I'll still go because the food is delish, hence why I still give them 4 stars.

This used to be my favorite restaurant, we have gone there for years, starting in early 2000 in the Plano TX location, and through all the different changes they've tried it's still been my favorite. Today we went and it's the first time that I sincerely think we will never go back.  They changed their food service, they have 3 different sizes to choose from. Small, medium, large. The medium is the old style dish. We decided to try the large, it's barely larger then the medium bowl and it's $2 more. They no longer have all you can eat, we were told you can pay $5 to go back up. So now you pay more to eat less. I overheard the manager tell people these changes were for better customer service, to give ppl more options. No one but kids will eat the small, so who were the options for if you used to just be able to pay $2 extra for all you can eat? It's not for the customer experience, it's corporate greed at its finest.  Then they now give you paper cards to carry with you as you feel your bowl, to hand to the griller's. What am I supposed to do with the paper card while I'm trying to use both hands to hold my bowl and reach under sneeze guard for food to put in my bowl? Bad ideas, did anyone ever try these ideas out before implementation? Extremely disappointed that corporate greed to increase profits year over year is ruining this restaurant the same way it's ruined so many over the years.

One of my favorite places to go when at work and have time for a lunch the dragon sauce is delicious and I love the edamame they serve. I don't stray on the sauce it's sweet and spicy never had bad service I go almost every week or every other week

If you've never been here, you've got to go! You make your own bowl and it's cooked for you so you get to choose everything that goes into it down to the spices. Prices aren't bad at all, especially considering how much food you get.

Last Friday night my husband and I were able to try this place.  We say we want to eat there every time we go to the movies.  Well unfortunately,  IT WAS AWFUL...The counter where you make your meal was disgustingly dirty, my rice was watery and when I got my meal it looked like a bowl of mush....something you would feed a bunch of chickens. I had chosen a ton of veggies and fish,  well they destroyed it during the cooking process.  It looked awful and it tasted worse. I also spent the later part of my evening in the bathroom!  (not just me, hubby too) Never again will I eat at Genghis Grill...I actually thought about calling my bank and disputing the charge. This place is nothing short a high end really bad Chinese food restaurant, you know the  ind where you are eating and you know you will regret it later!!!!    YUCK YUCK YUCK...NEVER AGAIN!!!!!!!!!

This place was pretty good.. it's a little bit confusing for the first time. I think I would have rather looked at the menu first rather then having the waitress try to explain it to us. I got the thai chicken bowl and i thought it was good. We will for sure come back here.

You can create a decent tasting meal here, albeit overpriced. The two stars are for the cleanliness of the establishment. This was my second time dining here and I left with sticky shoes from the filth on the floor. It looked like a disaster struck the ingredients area with a large amount of food on the ground and counter. All of the raw proteins were mixed together from people assembling their bowls. Plus, this time around they managed to mix up the starches my boyfriend and I ordered. He got my udon noodles and I ended up with his rice. They offered to fix it by scraping our toppings onto the correct starches. Not sure how that was supposed to work considering the noodles were mixed in. Don't think I'll be back to give them a third try.

I love genghis grill!! My first time that I went I made a really small bowl but this time I piles it on!! They changed their system now. You pick a size bowl and then they give you a bowl to pile your stuff in according to your selection. PRICES went up people!! $9 for small $12 for medium and $16 for a large.   Udon noodles are delicious and the honey teriyaki is the sauce to go with!! WARNING...if youchoose to put calamari in your bowl...once the food is cooked and all is said and done it is very chewy because it was over cooked on the grill. So make sure you don't use that as a main meat source.  I love the coke machine. I can try various selections that I have never had much less never even heard of. Raspberry coke, interesting but delicious.  They did ask if I wanted a to go  box and they gave my daughter a to go box. So maybe the price jack included the to go box because before you couldn't take anything home unless you purchased the bottomless bowl which was damn near $20.  All in all a great place with great food....but bring a jacket because it is always and I mean always freezing!!

Best Mongolian BBQ I've ever had anywhere hands down. There's also a full bar and sake bombers. Had to go rub one off in the bathroom due to my massive food chubby. OOM NOM NOM NOM NOM! FAP FAP FAP FAP FAP! Will repeat soon.
Loved the food & service at this place. Great concept to build your own bowl of healthy, fresh food.  Satisfied with the selection of meats, vegetables and sauces. Look forward to our next visit.

We frequent Genghis Grill quite a bit and I'm not sure what happened yesterday but our service was AWFUL! First, my bowl was cooked without the sauce I clearly placed next to my bowl.  Then, my boyfriend's bowl came without the rice he ordered. Lastly, our waitress came to check on us once and that was to drop off the wrong drink.  The place wasn't very busy so I was really surprised at the lousy service.
Stir fry selection is great.  They have everything from steak to fish to scallops.  The only downfall is during dinner rush it can take a long time to have your food prepared.

They need to hand out wax paper or some kind of barrier to use for your hand when mashing all your fixings into the bowls. Even if it's to discourage people doing it, we're still going to do it so you might as well help us be a bit more sanitary. Service was okay.

I ordered off the menu. My mistke. the tofu bowl was very flavorless. I will not be ordering of the menu anymore. I will build my own bowl from now on. The lunch prices are a little up there at $9 for a bowl, but you will not leave hungry as the portions are hearty.

Had a fantastic experience Sunday at Genghis Grill with my wife. The customer service from our service John C. and the great follow up from the manager was definitely 5 stars. The food was also great and up to par. Well done everyone at Genghis Grill!

I love the Mongolian style  bbq That being said this place needs Help !  How do you mess up a bowl When you make it yourself ? When you tell them fried Rice And your bowl comes back With noodles and black debris From a non clean grill Went 4 weeks in a row Hoping it would get better It was right 1 out of 4 times Not to mention I was the first one In there 1 time and the sit me the Furthest away from drink station What kind of servers don't get your drinks But expect a nice tip !

The whole concept was pretty neat. The things I did like about our visit was our server Anna and the food was aright. Other than that the raw food that you get yourself before its being cooked looks utterly disgusting the way it was put out. My husband had to convince me otherwise. But I don't think it was fresh. The whole time we were there the workers or I guess "food runners" we're running around the whole restaurant coming to everyones table with other people's food. It was kind of annoying because most of them looked completely clueless and kept bringing other customers food to us. We ordered 2 appetizers the Asian guacamole and the pot stickers. We got the guacamole at a reasonable timing but we didn't receive our pot stickers until 15 mins after our stir fry came out. I wouldn't recommend this place unless you're getting take out.

Sat for almost ten minutes without drink service. A family walked in at that time and was immediately helped. Spoke to the manager on they way out and they really didn't care. Won't be going back there,

Okay so this place is not a restaurant you want impress your first dinner date with, but the loud, spirited stir fryers who cook up your Mongolian BBQ dish exhibition style (fire & all)  makes it a chill place you want to get together with your family and friends.  It's a AYCE joint.  There's a salad bar type area where you build and create your stir fry dish. Reminds me of the buffet part of Fiesta, but here you have more choices.   Ambiance - Contemporary design, casual atmosphere, the tables were a little squished in and noisy from everyone talking so loud that busy body me knows what's up in your life cause I can hear your convo. heh heh.   Service - Was greeted and seated right away....which was surprising considering it was super busy.  Our server Janine did great  She always checked up on us, kept our drinks filled and kept us up on the status of food which was being prepared. I didn't feel that our server offering us appetizers was "up selling" whatsoever, it's like at the burger place asking if you want fries with that? Just say no thanks that's all if ya dont want any.   Food - All the ingredients appeared fresh, the meats were cold, I didn't see any meats that were soaking in their juices that I had read in some reviews. (believe me I would've just left if I saw that)  The veggie choices were also at cold temps and were crisp.  The only thing I wasn't too crazy about was the noodles I chose the first time around.  My husband really liked Udon noodles  though.   So the second round I passed on starches and loaded up on tofu, veggies, lil bit of beef, 2 seasonings, cilantro, skipped up on the starches and got a lettuce wrap instead. When I tried my second bowl of stir fry I was pleasantly surprised at my creation it turned out pretty good! My suggestion, skip the salt and  ease up on the sauces.  You dont want to drown out your dish with more than 1/2 a cup of sauce. It might end up being too salty or too sweet taking way the flavor of your dish instead of enhancing it.  Hence that "tiny" cup of sauce should be more than enough.  Or check out the little card recipes as your guide. That's your safest bet on your meal turning out good.  Both my husband and I liked our food creations and we enjoyed our first dining experience here.

Used to be ok, tried tonight and they stopped the  all you can eat.  So in other words you pay what a buffet costs and can only tty one thing. Pass.   At least until they change back to the original model.
Omg this place is so fun. Create ur own bowl and they cook it up for u!! Yummy!! New favorite spot and prices are so reasonable!!

While I like the concept of this place, the implementation is not done well. The ordering system is overwhelming and there isn't much guidance. They offer so many options and endless combinations but the face paced environment doesn't give you time to create something good. Also the buffet was all over the place. Not clean, didn't look fresh, droppings everywhere, empty bowls. $24 total for two medium bowls + tip. Very mediocre experience.

Our second time at this chain restaurant.  Soup was cold.  Portions are skimpy no matter what size of bowl you choose, and very expensive compared to like restaurants.  Do yourself a favor and find a Mongolian grill where you can eat the amount you want without killing your budget!  There's nothing special about this place.

At YC's Mongolian BBQ, I can put as much rice or noodles as I'd like in my bowl. At Genghis Grill, my meal only comes up 1/2 a cup of rice.  At YC's Mongolian BBQ, I mix my own sauces into my meat and noodles and put as much as I'd like in my bowl. At Genghis Grill, I get yelled at for not following instructions and not putting my sauce into a cup.  At YC's Mongolian BBQ, I pay at the front, get my bowl, and go through the line, and seat myself. At Genghis Grill, I get seated at a table, curiously wonder if my purse will be stolen while I'm going through the line, and later given a check prompting me to tip someone who only served me a drink.  At YC's Mongolian BBQ, the vegetables all look crisp at the station, and the rice is warm and steamy. At Genghis Grill, the vegetables are watery, as if they came from 99c cans at the supermarket, and the rice is hard/stale when it comes served in my bowl.  At YC's Mongolian BBQ, I get complimentary soup/rice/drink/yogurt with my dinner purchase. At Genghis Grill, I get a big headache and wonder why I didn't just drive down to YC's.

We come here pretty frequently.  I've never had Mongolian stir fry in other restaurants b'c the only other place I've seen them at is at buffets and there's just other things to eat there!  I have, however, been to several other Genghis Grill and this on as far as service goes, is pretty good.  We've had a decent experience just about every time we've gone there.  I like this one more than the one on the NE side of town at the Tempe Marketplace.  As far as food goes, I should just rate myself, right, and not GG?  In which case, I give myself 5 stars!  I'm really good at mixing sauces!  If you've never been to a Mongolian BBQ joint, basically, the food is raw, you pick up what  meats, veggies, spices and sauces  you want and they will cook for you on this like big open griddle thing.  Good stuff.    I think they have a pretty good selection of meats and veggies and  yes, sometimes it's a little messy but I would say they are usually on top of making sure the counters are clean.  The mess usually comes from the veggies that fall out of people's bowl.  You put the meats in the bowl first so it is unlikely it will come out of the bowl and contaminate the counter.  Unlikely I say but I'm sure possible.  My only complaint is how they changed their pricing structure.  Years ago when we used to frequent a GG in Dallas, it was once price, all you can eat.  I never packed my bowl the way I do now and if anything probably got less food because I didn't feel like I had to "get my money's worth".  Now if you want all you can eat, it's a different price than if you got just one bowl.  I was taken aback by that the first time we went to this place b'c it had been  years since we had been to one.  If you are curious about trying a place like this, I definitely recommend!  If you feel intimidated, don't be.  The waitresses are very helpful and they also have these "cards" you can pick up that tell  you what ingredients to pick if you don't feel adventurous enough to make your own.  My tip to you: PACK IN THE FOOD. Use your hands and push down if you have to.  THat's what we do.  One bowl is PLENTY.  Most of all, have fun!

This is why you shouldn't eat mall food.   Upon being seated, we were given metal bowls and were instructed to put our ingredients in these bowl. Choose your meats, veggies and sauce and hand it off the to dudes around the grill. Simple concept but I wished the ingredients were more fresh.   The entire restaurant was sticky. From their laminated menus to tables to the floor to the soy sauce bottles. No wonder they gave you wet wipes. You needed to sanitize your entire space before you ate.  My food was delivered to my table and just what I expected, junk. While I had a lot of control what goes in my food, for a first-timer, how the hell would I know what the sauces taste like?   They did have $1 mimosas during their happy hour. That was probably  the best part but the food was nothing more than a mish-mosh of crap.

I will never come back here again... They under cook their pork which is a big no no and got my son sick to his stomach. Then when we pointed it out to management he said what would you like me to do... Like really???
This place is awesome, but if you want to beat the crowd make sure and be there when they open. 11 AM.  Can't find any place with fresher ingredients made the way you want.

They have 3 appetizers and we tried all three:  chicken lettuce wraps, chicken potstickers, and garlic citrus edamame. I really liked the lettuce wraps and edamame.  For $10, you get to build your ow Mongolian BBQ bowl.  They give you a silver bowl oand a side cup for your sauce. You first pick your meats: natural chicken breast, pork loin, marinated white fish, pepperoni, ham, turkey breast, sausage,marinated steak, sliced beef, shrimp, scallops, calamari. Then you season your protein with salt, pepper, garlic, ginger, cayenne, etc. Then you top it with your choice of vegetables. I wish there was more room for vegetables, because they shrink when you stir fry them. Then, you select a sauce (all MSG-free.)  The Honey Soy sauce was good.  Then, you bring your bowl to the grill and let them know your choice of: steamed rice, fried rice, brown rice, udon noodles, pasta, flour tortillas.  Drinks are separate. You go to the drink machine and there's a huge selection of flavored soda, etc.  Some of the meat was a little hard, but overall, the flavors were pretty good. And the service was excellent!

Simply terrible!!! They messed up and gave us someone else's dish, then the "manager" had my fiance make a new order and wright it down. When he brought back his second dish it didn't even have the chicken in it... at this point we are so livid we asked for the check. They didn't  comp our meal or anything. What an awful company!!!! Will never eat there again or recommend this to anyone.
Solid spot for stir fry. Service is average, but the food is why it gets four stars. Really good bowls. No major complaints.

Airport food, thy name is mediocrity. Genghis Grill wasn't bad but it wasn't that good either. My husband ordered a Seoul bowl which I think was supposed to have Korean inspired flavors but it definitely didn't taste at all Korean. It was alright but nothing spectacular, and certainly not worth the money they charged for it.  I ordered a Thai bowl and it was depressingly bland. It was supposed to have a peanut sauce on it but it just tasted like frozen vegetables tossed with udon noodles. The chicken was tender and the tofu was alright but there just wasn't any flavor to anything. I ended up dumping the leftover sauce from the order of chicken potstickers we split over my noodles. It helped but it was unfortunate that I had to do that.  I did enjoy the potstickers so I'd recommend those, but definitely pass on the Thai bowl. The Seoul bowl was alright but certainly not something to write home about. All in all we spent close to 30 bucks on our mediocre meal but when you're stuck in an airport on a layover your choices are going to be limited.  Definitely be sure to check your order before you walk away though. When they first tried to hand ours over they were missing my husbands order and it took a few minutes to flag someone down to correct it. Also be sure to let them know if you have a food allergy because they use a large mongolian grill to cook the food so cross contamination will definitely happen if you don't give them a heads up.  I haven't been to a Genghis Grill outside of an airport before but my understanding is they're a decent place for Asian fast food. I'd consider going to one at some point but I don't plan on returning to this location, even if I am stuck in the Charlotte airport. There are other options that are hopefully less mediocre.

Such a cool concept; I would recommend to anyone looking for something different.  I went for the first time this past Sunday.  It was a little after lunch, not too crowded.  The waiter did a good job showing us the different size bowls for the build your own bowl.  Like I said, it was my first time - I got the medium bowl for $12.50 and it was so much food.    So what you do is pick your meats - and they have a large selection (steak, chicken, shrimp, bacon, etc); add dry seasoning then pick your veggies and then pick a liquid sauce.  You can sample the liquid sauces before committing.  I picked the island teriyaki and it was tasty.  But after you make the bowl with the raw ingredients you take it to their grill; this is when they ask what starch you want - rice, noodles, etc and then they cook it all in the open on this grill.   A few minutes later the waiter brings it to your table.    If you pick the right ingredients you can have an enjoyable meal.  And if you don't know where to start, they have suggestion cards - aka recipes.  But the medium was very filling.  For me it was two meals.  The prices seem a little high; so may want to check out during a weekday lunch.  But since it was my first time there, I signed up for their rewards program & they give you a FREE appetizer or dessert.  Definitely want to do that.

Over priced for sure.back home they have these all over and you get unlimited trips for $12-15 and the quality is higher. So when we ate here and it was that expensive and it's not even unlimited we were disappointed. Just okay. They do have good coupons out in the paper that never expire. You get 2 meals, 2 drinks, and a dessert for $22. Not too bad.

Wish I could give them 10 stars. I have been a fan of Mongolian BBQ for my whole life and short of my fathers restaurant this is the best. the veggies are always fresh, and the service is always great. The staff seem to actually enjoy working there and it goes a long way. You must eat here, you'll thank me.

It provides us a friendly environment to have a great time with our friends or families. The veggies are healthy and meats are fresh. Plenty of sauces will absolutely satisfy our special taste. Also, the self check-out machine is useful for those people who are in hurry.
This place is fun!  I love making my own dish!  Still trying to perfect the perfect dish but having fun trying.  I would love to see more seafood selections in the meats and other noodle selections.

I keep trying to like this place and each time this place just disappoints. On this particular occasion we went and the place was empty, which is a hard feat in itself.   The food bar was messy, and most of the items were only half available. The bowls seem to keep getting smaller.   They also don't much service oriented people around, everyone was pretty snippy and rude, though the employees were congregated at the front of the restaurant playing on their cell phones and speaking inappropriately with us within ear shot.  We went the whole meal without refills and to check up on us.  I know this is a "fast food diy" concept restaurant but for the prices and the fact that there are employees doing nothing a little attention would have done well by this place.   Meh, is the best this place gets.

The food is good but it sucks that you can't go back to the meat section once you passed the veggies section because they'll charge you $4. And if your allergic to anything be careful, because when I was there my cousin poured scallops on her bowl but when she got some, well it dropped on the calamari and I'm allergic to scallops but I wanted the calamari and I had a surprise of corn on my bowl because it fell on the pineapple lol There is no difference if you get the regular or large bowl, it looks the same portion, just don't get the small bowl
Food is great , love how you can make your own plate . The only thing that I didn't like was the bathroom , unpleasant odor .Would give 5 star but just because of the bathroom odor only 3 stars

This place was good, but I'm mostly concerned about the random worker (was she a manager?) who jumped in the back to grill up the food without washing her hands or putting on a hairnet or hat. I hope she didn't cook my food.....that alone lost them stars.

So I've been to Mongolian places before and we all know the routine...meat, veggies, sauce and a starch...but this place  kicks it up a notch and adds seasoning...in my option this is what makes it taste better! And the meat is not rolled up frozen pieces, its fresh cut chucks of whatever you can think of steak, chicken, even marinated fish.  I opted for steak and shrimp with veggies, potatoes and the 3G and regular Stir Fry sauce, with the spicy cayenne pepper, Tabasco and garlic seasoning over steamed rice....and it was delicious!  In my opinion, very reasonable with price, a variety of choices and food cooked to order...I will definitely be back!

Great place to eat! Stack your bowl as high as you can with meats and veggies, and be sure to pack on the veggies - they always shrink. They have the biggest variety of grains it's great. The servers are always nice and the touch screen fountain drinks are always a plus. Would definitely recommend!

I agree, cafeteria style and they cram you into a fast food type of eatery but, the hostess did move us from the uncontrolled kid area to a quieter area.  Our server was friendly and gives you a tour for first timers.  Pile all you can into the bowl since it all shrinks down big time.  I thought I put cabbage in there.....where did it go?  Anyway I liked it all with your many choices of meats, veggies, spices, and sauces.  So each time it's a different experience of flavor.  Of course their tea is freshly brewed.... A huge shout out to that!  We will definetly start this place into our rotation of frequent places to eat.

It's been over a year since I have been to this place once I have loved before. There is a new management team and you will notice a big difference. The cooks and the team are a lot nicer and understanding and the food is great. I had a bowl, drink and dessert. I like this a little more then how it was with the old management. I will be coming here more often now that the treatment is better.
First time coming here and it was great! Good food, fresh ingredients and great customer service. Definitely my go to place. Need to have more locations :)

I used to frequent here more often a few years ago but have gone less and less the past few years.  Something about this place is going down hill and I can't put my finger on it! The meat section always kind of creeps me out in terms of how sanitary it is , so when I come I stick to the veggies! What I do like about this place is the food tastes fresh and not greasy and comes out fairly quick!  Good option if you have vegetarian friends. I have never ordered off the actual menu so can't comment on that.

The food was great but the service was not desirable. They forgot my friend's lettuce wraps and we are on a time budget. It took 30 minutes for them to realize that she did get her food. Then the manager came over to apologize and gave her a buy one and get one bowl 20% off with a purchase of 2 drinks coupon.  And it doesnt apply to the unlimited bowl. They certainly know how to take care of customers (sarcasm). The people working there definitely were new and you can tell that they were being trained at that time. We wanted to pay because we were late for class and asked a different waiter to ring us up. They had to find the original server to deal with bill.  We would have went back but because this experience kinda blew. I dont think my friends would want to return.

So I've been here numerous times the past and it seems the format has changed.   I filled up my bowl only to hear one of the cooks at the end complaining about how much he makes and what is and is not going to do for his money. That being said I made sure he saw me put some money in is tip jar out of fear for my food.  When I got my food it was like only half of the topping came back, I was left wondering if I got the wrong bowl, but sure enough it was mine.   Not sure if I will go back anytime soon.

If I could give it 0, I would! We were greeted nicely, seated and shown what to do. After waiting a short time for our bowls, the manager came to chat and see how things were. They were great up until I found a ROACH in my food! They quickly took it away and offered brownies and another bowl for me. Reluctantly, I agreed to another bowl and went and made it. Got it to go so I could pick through it at home! The part that is really really not acceptable is that not one part of my meal was comped!! I have been a server for years and that is just unheard of! Needless to say we will not be going back! Our server Was super! But really, charging me for a bowl with BUGS! The manager said "it must have come in the cilantro, we get it in bulk and just rinse it" UGH!
Friendly staff , fresh protein , great sauces  .. Awesome place for a heavy weekend lunch  By the way if you check in you can get your second bowl for 1/ 2 off.
Had lunch there today. It was pretty ok. I wouldn't give it 4 stars, although my boyfriend might.   We got a lot of food and took it home and really good service.  Service : 4 Food: 3

This place is good. You get a card. You go pick how big you want your bowl. Fill it up with meats and veggies to the brim of what they give you. Pick sauce or seasoning. Pick noodles, rice, etc. They cook it you sit. And as long as your sauce was dank then the food don't stank. My dish was superb. Random meats, greens, garlic sauces and a spicy garlic something. I should have got noodles.cbut the fried rice was A1

I tried this place a couple months ago but forgot to review it. I am very happy this place exists. My girlfriend told me it was "soooo gooood" and I thought it would be alright but after coming here she was right. The food is delicious and the staff is friendly. I even had a 5-minute conversation with one of the servers about tattoos. Super relaxed place and friendly environment. But let's be real you guys want to know about the food. Well, the food was just AMAZING. I am begging my girlfriend to come back here but she doesn't want to because supposedly Genghis Grill is a Reno thing so she is keeping me away at least until I go to Reno with her and try it again over there. Why are girlfriends like this? Anyway, try this place. I'll come back after my Reno trip.

My wife and I went in for a late lunch on a weekday, a day I took off work - decided to catch a movie and eat at a place we hadn't been to before.  Genghis grill offers a buffet style Mongolian grill food where you pile up your proteins, veggies and spices into a bowl. Load up on sauces in separate smaller cups and tell the grill master what carb (rice, fried rice, noodles, etc) you want everything stir fried with. There are also small cards with ingredients that you can refer to, if you don't feel like taking a chance.  I picked chicken, steak and sausages from the meat section. Piled on onions, green peppers, baby corn, jalapenos and added a whif of dragon spice, garlic, salt and red chilli powder. For sauces, I picked the dragon sauce and one other - can't remember the name. Told the grill master (thats how they call them, I didn't come up with that!) everything stir fried with fried rice.  Ended up with too much food and dragon sauces & spice were more hot than I imagined. Somehow I got into beast mode and pretty much chugged all of it down, but word for advice for you all - when they tell you that the spices are hot, specially the ones on the bottom rack, believe them!  The only other Mongolian place I've been to was Bd's Mongolian grill out of state where they let you pile everything up in multiple bowls if you have the capacity for multiple bowls. Here, I was handed only one bowl by the waitress - not that I needed more than one, but felt restricted in picking veggies.  If you have a serious appetite, I suggest you check this joint out. If you don't like how your food turned out, blame yourself for picking the wrong ingredients.

Used to like coming here. Every time i'm on this side of town i'd make plans to stop for lunch. Never had an issue. This current visit was sad. My husband and I each ordered rice for our starch and there was only HALF of what we were used to getting. The portion was so small that we left hungry. When we asked a server what was up with portion sizes she said people had been complaining that there was too much starch. Huh? Too much? Well now theres not enough to even fill up a normal person!   I doubt we'll be back   At this point i'd rather frequent green valleys buffet for Mongolian bbq.

My family and I tried to eat dinner at Genghis tonight and where very disappointed.  My husband is allergic to gluten and we checked them out online before going and they where suppose to be very accommodating.  When our server came to our table we made it clear of his food allergy, when we made the food we made it clear to the lady helping you load your bowl, and when we got to the grill we told the cook about his food allergy and even asked for it to be made with rice.  The cook was suppose to cook his food separate of all the other gluten dinners so as not to contaminate his but the cook just threw it on the grill with everything else.  We told our water and he said he would correct the problem but when his dinner came it was with noodles witch contain gluten and would have made him sick.  In the end my husband left hungry and I left mad.  The service was bad and the place felt like a fast food restaurant.  I love Mongolian grills but my food was disappointing and even without the food allergy mix up I would not wast my money and go back.  They did offer us a free desert but they looked bad and contained GLUTEN.

If your looking for something fun and not just sit down and serve me then this is the place. You grab your bowl and fill it with choices of meats then down the line you select veggies and then sauce it up!! Then it's grilled perfection and deliver to your table. It's fun to choose what will go well together. Each person can make their bowl to their liking!!

Interesting way to get your meal. When they give you your bowl I advise you pack it full. I'm a big guy so the bowl isn't quite a full meal. Though, I will say it is enough. it's just that I like to get my fill if you know what I mean. You can pick up recipe cards that guide you through the preparation phase and then you hand it over to the cooks. Usually a wait/line to get in on weekends. Concept is interesting, food is good. We hit this place every two or three months for variety.

Very much like the Flattop Grill in Chicago, though with this I think you just get one trip? That part was unclear to me. The build your own stir-fry is great if you know what you like, and how to combine flavors--not so if you can't! "Salad bar" seemed clean, though the floor did not. Refill your own drinks. Seemed quick and efficient. They are part of a rewards program.
You get some great Mongolian at Genghis Grill! I like this place, but might be a little expensive for an everyday lunch option...

I wish they had a "0" star option too!  The service and food was awful. Just a bunch of kids running the place.  The place closes at 10pm but when we went in there at 8pm all the workers were too busy cleaning to go home early to help us.  The food was burnt  on one side and raw on the other. The manager was too busy flirting with the other help. We couldn't get drinks because all the glasses where dirty, we were told by our waitress. We asked for the manager before we left at 8:45 and was told he already went home for the evening. What kind of manager leaves a bunch of teenager to run the place?   NEVER GOING BACK!!!!

Tried out Genghis Grill because there is a similar place up North in Maryland where I am from. This placed turned out to be a decent choice. You are seated and then get a choice between the menu items or the make your own stir fry option. The most popular choice and what we did.   It is set up like a salad bar, you can fill your bowl up as full as you want, then some guys on a grill will grill it up for you and your server brings it to your table when its ready. The food was OK, not amazing but worth it for the price. It definitely fills you up. Service was good. I might come here again if I am looking for something without a wait on a busy weekend night.

Good food... Great waitstaff... Long lines :( .. Lots of combinations to put together... You should have some general knowledge of flavor combinations... Great place to try new flavors!!! We will be back!!

I've been to Genghi's Grill 3 times now and the service here is always great. By that I mean the servers are extremely friendly, and always prompt with your beverage refills. They really don't have too much to do in most cases since this is a true Mongolian style BBQ restaurant where you go up yourself to select your food before delivering it to the grill cooks.   Your food can taste anywhere from mediocre at best, to outstanding ... and it all depends on you. That's the beauty of this place. You select everything in your 'bowl' so you can truly create exactly what you want.   You start with selection your proteins/meats: there are about 15 choices ranging from chicken to pepperoni to scallops, and anything in between. Next you hit the seasoning station where you can jazz up the meat however you like. Then you hit the veggie station. Again, choices are almost endless here. You end the line up by picking what you'd like to flavor your meal with, with about 12-15 sauce choices. They're all awesome, but I personally like 1/2 ginger citrus & 1/2 island teriyaki. Maybe splashed with some honey soy.  Walk it all over to the grill where you select your 'starch' from white or fried rice, udon noodles, spiral pasta or tortilla wraps.   It's very easy to 'over do-it' with your bowl because everything sounds good. Be careful not to mix too many flavors or you'll end up with a disappointing meal!

The food here is always amazing!! And I always come at night and sit in the bar! Mike is wonderful; always friendly, courteous, funny and has the perfect amount of distance but also being available. I will continue to come back :)
It is what it is.. stuff that bowl. Better quality meat than YC's. Fun atmosphere.

Used to go there and get a bowl and load it up. Now they're monetizing it with three bowl sizes, previous cost is now the small bowl. Waiters are a bit agressive to get their tips.  Great food, every time, i like the shreaded beef with brown rice, oh yeah! A bit pricy though, like $15 out the door with tips.

I really like it here. Our server was helpful and showed my husband and I how the restaurant works. You get a bowl and are able to fill it up with as much meat and veggies you want at the bar/station. You also pick your spices the sauce and the starch. The food is practically cooked in front of you (if you hang around the grill). The price is very affordable and if you want all you can eat its an extra $3.  There was a fundraiser taking place durning our visit and even though it was busy the service was relatively fast. I'm looking forward to going again.
Heath department didn't find anything on inspection, but given how fast the wheels turn... Management doesn't care any more than their staff did the night of. Still not going back...
The food is only good if you know how to season food...pretty pricy. But I'm in love with there mango lemonade!

Drove out here from Cali for the weekend and noticed I had a microwave in my hotel room. I looked up big eatery spots locally rather than the strip because Vegas is known internationally for their food. Genghis Grill came highly recommended by the locals. I went in around lunchtime and got the large bowl. I love this semi-buffet-ness of picking out your own portions of proteins and veggies and then having them cooked up in your face Benihana style with your choice of starch.(If this place would had more protein choices, I would have gave this place 5 stars) You're responsible for your portions, sauces and seasoning so, if it doesn't taste good, you got nobody to blame but yourself. When getting your bowl cooked up by the chefs, give 'em at least of couple dollars so they cook your food more thorough with love. You even get to get your own drinks, so if you're thirsty....again blame yourself. Service was friendly and decent. You get up and do everything yourself so they're minimal anyways in your experience. For basically $20 I got to eat 2 meals in one day and had more money and time left to play the tables. Definitely have a good game plan when you come in here to maximize your bowl. I like to stack proteins then veggies on top of each other in that order. Good eats and experience.

I am upset that it took me so long to try this place. It's was absolutly fantastic!! The service, the atmosphere, the drink selection, the food!! Walking in, I didn't know it was anything like it was. First, you're seated and your server explains how it all works, they take your drink order, explain and offer some appetizers and then asks what size bowl you'd like..small, medium or large. Once you pick your bowl size, you then go up to the bar/buffet area where you put choices together. Pick from multiple different raw proteins and veggies...fill and pack that bowl with as much as you possibly can...pick your seasonings and then your sauces. Then, take your creation to the grill, pick your starch and give it to the cooks to put it all together and cook it all up for you. You can watch your creation come together or take a seat and your server will bring it to you. Our server today was Kelly and she was absolutely amazing. She explained it all perfectly and answered all of our questions. She even came up to the food line with us to make sure we knew what to do and to make sure we were 100% comfortable with what to do. We ordered the pork pot sticker appitizer which was amazing and my friend and I both loved the bowls that we created. I went with a chicken dish and her with a beef. I can't wait to go again and put some other stuff together. They have so many selections and concoctions that can be made..it's going to be an amazing adventure every time. I would recommend that everyone try this place at least once. You will not be disappointed!!

I love this great Mongolian grill restaurant. The service is friendly. I love how you can get three options like Udon noodles or brown rice and you can add an egg. They have a good selection of vegetables, meats, seafood and spices. The only bad thing is that I wish they had little recipes to make customized sauces. Love how these bowls taste. Be careful of what size you get since you add three options, you'll fill up quicky with noodles and brown rice.

I went to Genghis Grill twice within the first 2 weeks of its grand opening.  It is a Mongolian BBQ restaurant with an unusually large number of meats, vegetables, rice, noodles, and sauces to choose from.  If it's your first time, your server will show you through the buffet.  You fill up a bowl with meats and vegetables, and a small cup with your sauces (which you can sample in the line), and hand it over to a grill cook for preparation.  Choose your starch - rice, noodles, etc. - and you can watch it being grilled and pick it up, or have your server bring it to you.  Pros: delicious IF you get the right flavor combination, and some of the best customer service I've had in a Las Vegas restaurant.  Cons: pricey!  The bowl for your selections is very small.  You will need some architectural skills to build up your bowl very high.  The problem is that the vegetables cook down, so your prepared BBQ winds up quite small, and it's even served in a special bowl to make it look like more food than it really is.  They are also stingy with starches.  On my most recent visit, I overdid the sauce - not their fault - but the result was so strong that it needed rice to mellow it out.  The stingy 1/2 cup serving isn't enough anyway.  I wound up taking it home and make a pot of rice, and enjoyed leftoovers.   Tip: I recommend going at lunchtime for the unlimited bowl option and just make small bowls until you figure out what flavor combination you like.  Lunch is much cheaper than dinner.  Another tip: sign up for their Khan Club.  It's free and you get good deals through email.

I love the idea of this place! The fact that I can get my money's worth by filling my bowl up with as much meat and veggies as I can and create my own combinations of sauce! The only thing I didn't like was how long we had to wait for our food to get cooked. Not a place to go when you're already starving. But def a great place to go any other time :)

We were shopping across the street when we got a big whiff. A strong smell of onions and meat came wafting down to entice us in to have some mongolian bbq for the first time. We followed our noses and went and got seated in this busy place. That is surely a good sign. WRONG!   The server asked us if we had been there before to which we both answered "no". She handed us our menus and really tried her hardest to explain how the operation went down, but she was a little tongue tied. Can't fault her for it. Who knows how many times a day she has to repeat the process to newbies like us. So she tells us how it works as we peruse the menu.   Most of the menu is quite unnecessary as we went and got everything for ourselves anyway. Why was there a section that displayed drinks when we had to go and get drinks for ourselves in one of those newer Coca Cola machines where there seems to be a millon different selections? That is the only good thing about that place unfortunately. The only thing the menu really should be is an appetizers menu. There were about 3 extra pages that could have been eliminated.   After ordering some chicken potstickers we were on our way. We went up with our bowls and got in line to pick our ingredients. Some of it looked suspicious. I thought it would be rude to put my head in and sniff for myself if the seafood or chicken went bad. I tried to play it safe and went with beef. I added a multitude of spices, garlic, salt, pepper, etc. to my mix. I was anticipating good things because the smells that were all around were promising. We got up to the place where they take our raw bowl and cook it for us. I decided on the spiral pasta. We got some drinks and sat down. I understand there were others ahead of us in line. I understand it was busy. I understand that Sunday nights are not the best time to get speedy service. This was taking forever! My boyfriend got his food first. It smelled good, but it seemed to be "barely" cooked all the way. He is not one to complain so he ate it anyway. My food came about 15 minutes AFTER his. Even though I was right behind him in line. My food was also barely cooked. The pasta was very bland. Even though I filled my little 'cup' of stir fry sauce up to the top it was not enough. Most of my food tasted like plain noodles with hits of flavor every now and again. Immediately after eating I felt sick. I know it was the meat. We were never checked on. I had to track down our server to find out about our potstickers that never came. She acted surprised. She asked us if we still wanted them. I said yes. I wouldn't have ordered something I don't want. It was a mistake. I should have said no. They came out rushed. She must have forgot to put the order in and was rushing the cooks. The skin was not fully cooked and was like uncooked pasta. Crunchy. Blech!!! Never again. No apology about the late appetizers. Just dumped it on the table and left. Not happening. We learned our lesson. We should have read the Yelp reviews before wasting our time and money (and my squeamishness) .
This was excellent, quick service. Very tasty food and every option you can imagine.  ________  Great eats, excellent service, second time here in the last week.

We came here 12/19/2014 @ around 0630. This was not our first time and absolutely love the soda machine. We sit down and it takes a minute for the waitress to get to us. It is okay no big deal but what happened next was hard to believe. There was a full on fight between a male waiter and a waitress he was complaining about her messing up our bill for our table (we haven't gotten food yet). We were not even involved, he kept saying to the waitress " you are an idiot". So finally that's over and I hear from across the room from another waitress " IS THAT A REAL DIRTY DIAPER" the waiter then looks at her and looks at what is in his hand brings it to his nose and responds "YES". This was the same waiter who was in the fight with another waitress earlier. He then proceeds to toss the diaper in the trash. Yep you know where is this going and walks straight up to where the food Is prepared and picks up a plate of hot food and brings to our table (same hand that had the diaper). I had eyes on him the whole time and never went to wash his hands. We regretfully can never go back for this reason.

The trick with the Genghis Grill is to either learn how to pack your food in a bowl or buy the bottomless bowl for a few dollars more.  That said, there isn't much of a selection of food choices other than the line where you pick what you want; and though there is cards to assist a person to make particular dishes, the reality is you are going to make-up your own version by sticking whatever you can into the bowl without it falling all over the place.    The menu offers a few appetizers that cost as much as the bowl, while the rest of the menu offer a variety of drinks.  When you are going on the line filling your bowl, if you are a indecisive person, you will be pressured by others waiting behind you to move fast.  They do allow you to try samples of the sauces, which is a good thing; but it will taste somewhat different after its cooked.  Overall, it's a okay place, but you gotta know what you want before you start grabbing the raw ingredients, or you may make something you might not like when it arrives at the table.  Good luck!  Oh yea, they accept the Ballantyne Card, so if you got it... use it, it will save you some money.

The food is amazing.  You get to make it how you like it and with so many options for meats, veggies, spices, and sauces, if it taste bad than you probably picked the wrong combinations.  Ive been twice in the last week and look forward to eating here again.  For $10 I got more than I could eat and took the rest home.  Yeah you can pay a few bucks more for all you can eat, but if you pack as much into your first bowl you probably won't need any more.  I love spicy food, so I made a bowl of seasoned beef, chicken, brocoli, lots of jalepenos, peppers, garlic and used 2 different sauces and it was amazing.  My wife and kid love this place as well.  I definetly would suggest giving this place a try.  The servers have also been very polite and the atmosphere is exactly what I would expect which is a nice cozy place to enjoy a meal.  This is now my 2nd favorite place to eat after (El-Torito Cafe)!!!

The server Brett was AWESOME!!! the restaruant is a little like a maze.. The food was really good. Picky eaters would be happy here. They have a huge variety and the food is plentiful. They even have wonderful suggestions.Also, it's user friendly.

Glad we found this place. Lots of healthy options and great for picky eaters because you can build your own bowl. At lunch, there were three difference sized ceramic bowls, which they have on display for you to choose from. Once you choose a size, they hand you a seemingly small metal bowl to load your toppings into. As a chubster, it seemed small until we realized that they add in your starch when they cook it for you...you don't add it into the small metal bowl.    My advice...go light on the self-serve spices because the sauces are loaded with flavor and sodium galore. Also add more meat than you think you need because it shrinks up significantly. Put broccoli on the bottom to build up. Staff wasn't very good at recommending sauce combinations, but you can ask to sample any of them before committing. When you go up to the cook counter and they ask for starch, they will let you do a combination (I got 1/2 brown rice, 1/2 udon noodles). Bring a dollar or two in cash for the cook's tip (I always like to know this ahead of time since I rarely carry cash).   All-in-all, a great meal. Our server was attentive and friendly and the food was fresh with many options. Far better than YC's with a better/cleaner atmosphere. A star taken off because it took quite a while for us to be greeted with no one at the front desk and several staff walking by without acknowleging us. The staff behind the bowl station were unfriendly and clearly disinterested in being there. We were also bummed that there were no shrimp or scallops as an option when listed on the menu. The fish and people behind the bowl station were such a small part of the experience that it wasn't a deal-breaker.   Give it a try! Yummmmo.
Reheated pre cooked food. You think it will be fresh because you watch them throw it on the grill but it was actually pre cooked and reheated.  Soft vegetables and tough as jerky chicken

The food is good, if you know how to pick and mix your flavor sauces.  I wish they had some menu about combinations to make so I did not have to figure it out.  Love that you can put cabbage in your stir fry and no do starches.  However, this place is Pricey for what you get.  $15.00 is a full order entree at most Asian style restaurants that is shareable.  All of your protein and vegetables have to fit in this bowl and things like spinach cook way down.  I hate to say this but to get your money's worth you really need to just get protein and pack it in there really well.  The service is excellent but the beverages are pricey as well and they are self serve.  I think for four people our check was $100.    Its just a little over the top for a casual Asian place in pricing.

Ok went for the 1st time- kinda put up a fight... in the past I have been to plenty of buffett or make your own type places and end up w a bowl of uneatable food and a belly still angry, hungry and sad. I gave in and the people I went with 2 of 3 of us had never been here-  We were greeted at the door by hostess. She was a pleasant young gal who asked have we been here before- I think she could see my lack of excitement or want to be there but talked with ad as she sat us explaining that out server would be right over and if I had any doubts or dislikes to come let her know- So comes in our sever- Jaakko (yes this is his name) what a lovely man, his attention to everything and detail was over and beyond. He was not only friendly but he ooozzed hes passion for his job and love ove what he did. He explained how the ordering and making of the bowls worked- we laughed and he broke the ice and fear of this new place for me. He more then once said he would suggest ideas or I could read/ get us cards provided w recipes to make. He also was helpful on serving size (3 to choose from) it seems so simple but cups are deceiving and you could easily order a size WAY more then you could eat if this wasn't explained. The line you go through has a huge selection of meats and veggies. The selection is so vast you could eat 3 meals a day for a week with out having the same meal. You get to choose a sauce to add flavor along w seasoning and then off to the cooking area. Your asked choice of starch or even cabbage (vs rice, noodles, ect). I was offered an egg to add to it and it was a great success! I cant even tell you the shock of feeling like a chief and having control of  what I was eating and what was added or not. I was asked and offered if I didn't like it to be able to remake it but it was so good I cant wait to go again.  Now this isnt fine dine but for sure not a fast food place... it was a great costumer service experience and I cant tell you how great our service was. Thank you. Cant wait till I try more boldly bowls!!

With a successful restaurant in Tempe Marketplace, I decided to grab a relaxing dinner at their PV Mall location after a hard day at work.  I should have thought twice about this poorly managed restaurant which unfortunately is carrying the Genghis Grill name.  When I arrived, the hostesses did not greet me with the same energy as the hostesses in the Tempe location.  Specifically, I waited for four minutes at 8:30pm on a slow night.  The variety of food was slim, and they no longer carry shrimp.  Though the cooks were kind enough to ask if I had food allergies, I watched as two cooks exhibited poor practices.  They dropped food onto the counter, then picked it up and put it back in some poor person's bowl!  Unappetizing....  My waitress was attentive, but when I mentioned my disdain for this location's choice to discontinue shrimp (it is one of my favorite items with Genghis), I overheard the snide manager, counting money at the end of the bar, tell my waitress "If he wants shrimp tell him to f---ing go to Red Lobster across the street."  Classy.  Though my waitress did an excellent job, that manager's remark ruined the ambiance of my whole meal.  Much of the staff at this location varied.  My waitress did an excellent job, but that is where the compliments stop.  The cooks and other staff members looked disheveled, and I had the unfortunate experience of watching one male staff member reach under his shirt and scratch his chest.  Perhaps my standards were too high as I have been spoiled by the appeal of the Tempe staff.  The Tempe staff's uniforms were in unison, and the diverse staff all remain appealing to give diners a great experience.  The PV Mall Location appeared to be comprised of a poorly trained group of people who do not take pride in their work.  As someone who waited on tables for 10 years, I understand the challenges and mistakes a waiter may make in one night, especially on Thursdays.  I do however recognize customers go out to eat to be entertained and to allow someone else prepare meals and not have to worry about dishes after a busy hectic day.  Customers should not cringe, wondering if the cooks are preparing their food properly or happened to have dropped your food before serving you.  I hope Genghis' corporate offices keep an eye on this place, because it is in bad need of an overhaul.  If they want to protect the Genghis brand, they may want to focus on improving this poor excuse of a franchise.

So you go through the usual buffet kind of line to fill your bowl and then give it to the cook at the end.   The problem: There is no one tending the "buffet" and almost every thing was empty.  The chicken and beef bins were empty.  There was plenty of ham and pepperoni (what?).  The broccoli, bean sprouts, baby corn, onion and tofu bins were also empty.  We complained about it, and the staff said sorry, but did not do anything about it.  Boooo.

This is not a review or the staff or product, just ownership and management.   Usually I would rate my visits a 4 or 5, but not today. Staff was all friendly and helpful as usual, but the bowl "bar" where you build your bowl was VERY understocked. Several items were low, and a few items  weren't even available, broccoli, snap peas, sprouts, mushrooms for example, weren't available. When we asked about this, the lady restocking what they did have just said they didn't have it and that was that. I later heard one of the cooks telling someone else that the produce provider had been price gauging or something and they had caused the issue.
