This was my first time in and didn't really know what to expect. I guess I was going to compare it to YC's but it's really not the same. Genghis is a sit down restaurant where you create your own bowl, add sauce and they cook for you. I liked the selection of proteins, veggies and the array of sauces. I had someone helping me on all my selections and really enjoyed being able to sample sauces. When I got to the cooking station, I liked that you could add extra ingredients (I chose an egg). Service here was really great and I enjoyed my bowl!   I would definitely come back!

Ate here yesterday with my wife. It was an hour before closing but the staff were still very very welcoming. Erin, who was our waiter that time, was very entertaining! We really had a good laugh! The guy who cooked the food was awesome too! 5/5 will come back again for sure!

Healthy food great service server Wendy explained how it works took us on a small tour on how to begin a bit confussing for those who had never done the Mongolian Style of filling your own bowl with choices exp. before.  Being that I had this exp. before it was slightly different since I was expecting a bowl to fill up the choices before grilling as they had a choice of silver plates asking you if you would like small, medium, or large.  Well I chose medium started to fill my plate with choice of Siracha Chicken and when I t was time to pick out the spices just have fun with it do not get technical choose what excites you same with the veggies whatever catches your eye and at the end when it comes time to choose your sauces for flavor do half of one choice in your side cup and add half of another flavor sauce choice in the same side cup.  Finally when you get to the grilling area again do not get techinical have fun I did half Udone Noodles and half Brown Rice.  Quite enteresting dish when the server brought our food I created a very flavorful exotic and fun mix as long as you do not get techinical just choose what appeals to you and do now worry how it will come out and that is how I will say you will enjoy this place have fun and just get creative with your choices!  If you get to techinical you will miss out on the exp. of having a creative dish that you just invented and do not worry everything is great here so sure to be flavorful!

first time here, definitely won't be my last. my bowl was awesome, and the jalapeo shrimp cheesy bread was delic!!!  my cocktail of choice was the warrior smash, simply groovy our waitress alyssa is a rockin' !!! her energy is so positive and radiant ghengis grill is very lucky to have her, kudos
Food is good. Service is a little short on people and they forgot a lot of things. But still a great family establishment.

My wife loves this joint , but every time we go (3x's total) the service is pretty sub-par...I dig the whole concept of "building your own bowl" but when that place gets a little busy they get less productive (behind the grill and in the floor)...the only plus about the joint I can say is that they have that bad-ass beverage machine that lets you go wild and release you're inner mixologist !!...food's decent tho service could be better tho.

My boyfriend and I went to this location because I just could not resist Genghis, and it started off okay, but when we went to put our ingredients together, I was waiting almost 2 minutes for an employee to get done dumping new (FROZEN, ZIPLOC'D) meat before I could grab any to put in my bowl. he didn't even apologize for the wait or acknowledge my presence. Once I had my frozen (mixed with soggy and old) meats, I moved on and sat down. Our waiter was not attentive or energetic at all, it seemed like he hated his job which brought down our enthusiasm. And to top it all off, my boyfriend woke up the next morning sick as a dog from the food we ate the night before. This bums me out because now I won't be back to any other Genghis Grill.

My fianc and I were disappointed with the service tonight. Our waitress Victoria avoided us on purpose and was more interested in talking to the bartender all night. She would offer refills to people around us but skip us. I've been coming to this location since 2011. We will definitely not be back! I celebrated my 21st birthday here and fast forward 6 years, the service is really bad.

I have been here a few times and the food is very good. However, I have also been to YC's, which is the same type of mongolian grill cooking, and I'll have to say, I prefer YC's. Pro's of Genghis is that there are more meat, veggie and carb options, but you get a WAY smaller bowl to begin with. YC's cooks your food when you're standing there and  then you take it to your table, Gengis has you go to your table, then they serve it to you. This didn't work very well when there was a group of six of us and there was about a 20 minute wait form when the first bowl came out and the last.  Basically, the food is great, depending on what you make. Price is a bit high and the wait is a bit long. I would suggest coming here in a Wednesday afternoon with no more than two in a party.

On 12/17/2014, i visited genghis grill for the 1st time. I dined at the Tempe Marketplace location with friends and family.   Upon entering the 'food line' to determine my bowl size and select my food ingredients, i immediately noticed the vast amount of food and debris on the floor in front of the food selection area, which was certainly not a positive impression of my 1st visit. During the length of our entire dining experience, that floor area was never cleaned up.   When selecting my bowl size an employee assisted but constantly inspected the bowls for cleanliness prior to distributing them to the customers and 'discarded' about 25% of the bowls on the 'clean' shelf. This made me uncomfortable because if the employee could not trust that the items would be clean, how could I?  Reaching the food selections located in the rear of the display cases was actually impossible to do so while maintaining proper hygiene. Because of their location in relation to the plastic sneeze shield, most customers including myself had to actually duck under the shield and reach our entire upper bodies under the shield to reach the food items in the rear of the display cases. This made the food selection process very difficult because the height clearance did not allow for much room to reach the food items in the rear of the display case  Many of the food items were in very low supply and we had to ask the employee to refill many of them, such as the spices, vegetables and sauces. I asked myself, 'Why aren't these items more constantly monitored by the employees to maintain proper food levels?'  my food was cooked and actually delivered with some burnt remains from what appeared to be an unclean grill surface or burnt remnants of another source.  I relay this information to you because i feel this location needs immediate attention and for the staff to be properly trained or retrained.  I am very disappointed by my 1st visit to any genghis grill.

Austin is a horrible server!!! We were sat and waited 15 mins. Kept making eye contact with our sever & he kept running off! To top it off, they seated a part of 5 AFTER we had been waiting 10-15 minutes and he immediately went to them!! I like the food here but we walked out on him & didn't order anything...feel like never coming back after Austin's horrible customer service & serving skills!

I love coming here. The food is delicious and very filling. I have only ever ordered the regular and walked out stuffed. They have a large variety of foods and flavors you can  add to your bowl. I like that it is made with exactly what I want. Yes they have cards that give you some recipes, but why not go crazy and try your own concoction. The staff is always friendly and helpful if it is your first time.

I like the Mongolian Barbecue concept... I really do.  So, when my friend suggested we head to this place for dinner, I was all about it.  I read the reviews that came before mine, and tried to be optimistic too...   And while it appears that GG has addressed the complaints about not being vegetarian or food allergy friendly, they can't do much about the chain feeling one gets upon dining here.  They can, however, work on their service, which was unattentive and unorganized during my visit.  My friends and I went up to prepare our bowls at the buffet.  I prepared mine with shrimp, calamari, imitation crab meat, vegetables, egg, and a mix of honey soy and spicy sauce.  I handed it over to be cooked up and put on brown rice, and it actually turned out pretty decent.  I ended up deciding I wanted to go up for seconds.  This was after our waiter just threw our check down at our table without asking if we wanted anything else.  My friends went for dessert and I went for another bowl after that.  I guess our waiter took the check back when we flagged him down to let him know this.  I was busy finding the hostess to request a new bowl for my second helping.    I had to ask several times after that for some more water, and when I was waiting for my cooked food to be delivered, the food runner attempted to deliver the wrong bowl to my table, even admitting that sometimes they get the numbers mixed up... not a good sign.    If you like dining at places like Sweet Tomatoes, (not that there is anything wrong with that... I even hit up Sweet Tomatoes every now and then), this place could be up your alley.  At dinner, it's $9.99 for one trip to the buffet and $13.99 for a bottomless bowl.  If you drink and/or have dessert though, it can get pricey for what it is, but again, the concept is solid... there is something for everyone to choose from whether you like meat, chicken, fish, noodles, rice, etc...  I would suggest GG do a better job with training their servers and keeping the buffet bar stocked and clean.  I'd also suggest they do something with recipes for sauces as we all just guessed on how much sauce to use and made our own combinations of ingredients.  I have experienced better, but I'm not saying I'd never go back.  Just go in with lower expectations (it's not going to be a gourmet experience by any means), and you'll be fine!

The service is good and I love the bowl of meat and sauces. The dinners are a overpriced so I had to give this place three stars. For the same dinner price (or even a dollar more) you should get all you can eat like it used to be. Also I really struggle with tipping here as you put together your bowl and get your own drinks but you're recommended to give 15% -18% on the receipt.

Eat here every couple months and is a great place to get an affordable Asian fix. The restaurant GM is amazeballs, is extremely friendly and accommodating, She makes the visit all the more worthwhile. The food is as good as the ingredients you choose. Worth the visit for lunch or dinner,

Always have a great experience at Genghis Grill! Was greated by four people when I came in, continuously checked on, and even checked on by four different people!  Everyone is always so nice, helpful and polite! 5 stars for customer service! Oh, and my bowl was perfect too!
It's pretty good, not great.  The price is rather high for the quantity you get, particularly if you're mostly a veggie eater.  The service is good.

I hate these kinds of places where you have to pick out your own food and flavors, but against my better judgement I went anyway. I should have listened to my gut and found something better around the corner. Of course my food was TERRIBLE and instead of being able to be upset with the chef, I had only myself to blame.   I could have made my own terrible pedestrian stir fry at home!

I've read the bad reviews from people who have actually eaten there, but I was another "walk-out" before trying. I knew there would be a problem when the server tried to tell me how simple it was. "Just pick your protein" she said several times.  Next she admonished to pile on the vegetables because they "shrunk down to nothing!"  So, I was handed this tiny bowl that had to accommodate both!  What should I do? The last time I had so much pressure was a Vegas timeshare presentation!  I had an idea, go with one of the bowl suggestions on the board behind me.  So I said to the kitchen helper, "make me a Korean Bowl, please."   Her reply was "you do that, the description of ingredients is only a guide."  My wife said, "ok, where's the scallops?"  That was when she was told they only had them at night.  Genghis Khan was a barbarian and true to its name, this place was pretty barbaric. Fortunately, we escaped with our lives!

We met here for lunch.  First of all there were no shrimp. Then we made our choices,  between the coming stone and our table,  our meat/ fish choices had disappeared and then we got bowks that were not ours.   The manager told my elderly mom that her name sounded Like that of a man. Very tactful!  Not a good experIence.

The staff was not very informative.  The bowls were too small for the price. Had trouble fitting all of the food in the bowl without spilling it everywhere.  Hard to reach the ingredients in the back.  The buffet area was too messy and did not appear to be regularly maintained. Wasn't worth the $10.

Sat at the bar and the bartender blatantly ignored us. She made drinks literally right in front of us and didn't even look at us. She finally greeted us unenthusiastically and my friend ordered a beer. She didn't even ask me what I wanted. My friend drank her entire beer and the bartender never took my order. More guests sat at the bar and she ignored them too. My friend left a $5 on the bar for her beer and we walked out.

I have to say i was very happy with the service this time around. They have new owners and i love the new settings inside. It is more personalized where the server actually calls your name instead of a number and it looks alot more organized and cleaner. I will be going back because im once again a fan of the service.
The food was very tasty and our server Nick was incredible at taking care of us and very friendly. We like customizing our own bowls and the kids always eat it all! Definitely will be going back.

I pass by this place all the time, but that was a mistake by my part. The food is piping hot and very tasty! And jaakko's served us well. It's fun to eat because you get to fill a bowl with raw ingredients, and watch the cooks prepared for you. The rice was a little dry but the noodles were so good. Look at the pics

This and YC's are some of the only Mongolian places I have tried here in the Valley, and I think they are somewhat comparable. I like both, each has one or two things going for it that the other doesn't. At YC's they have a self serve soup and rice bar that I really like, fresher veggies, more options of veggies, bigger bowls, and the prices seem much better. Genghis has some yummy spices, fresher meat, more options of meat, and I like the sauce a lot (dragon sauce). Because I was comparing Genghis to YC's, I felt like it had a few short comings, but because it was good, it is hard to complain.   I had a very kind waitress who talked with me a little, which I appreciate cuz I was eating alone while out running errands.   I had chicken, Mongolian veggies (bell peppers and onions, cabbage, bok choy, cilantro, jalapenos, squash, dragon salt, dragon sauce and brown rice. It made a great stir fry, and the watermelon iced tea was sooooooooooo good.   It was hard paying $16 for lunch just for myself when I could have eaten at Greek wraps across the street for maybe $7 or Jersey Mikes for $7ish also. Or made the same thing at home for maybe $3. Lunch should be cheaper in my opinion.

Have had a hard time finding a mongolian bbq place in the Vegas Valley and I am very happy I found this one. It's not the best I have had but I am so grateful at this point to have this one it's perfect.   P.S. The service is very good. Very polite, friendly and helpful staff.
Great lunch option for a family or work group. Seating does get a bit crowded (and service has been a bit spotty), though.

Random visit as I was shopping at the Tempe Marketplace and Asian cuisine was on my mind! The original location I visited was years ago at the paradise valley mall area, which has since closed. Good to know this establishment is still around ! I love how you can make your own bowl and smash as much as you like to appease your cravings. I honestly don't quite remember what i mixed in my medium bowl besides the main ingredients of steak and scallops. I do know I added garlic , greens if some kind and had to have an egg mixed with my fried rice as the chefs go to work frying my concoction to this meal you see attached ! Great to see that genghis is still around !
Been here a couple of times. Happy hours are $1 for a pint of beer! Filling and worth spending $20 on food and few drinks. Whatever you dump in your bowl is totally your choice. So be wise! :)

Gone down hill since they opened.   Used to be my favorite spot.   It's become filthy. Yesterday ate with my boyfriend and both got sick and still today suffering.   My Roomate on a different occasion had the same issue..  Clean it up, get more organized and it'll become golden!

I definitely consider myself a regular at this location, and I love each visit! The restaurant is always very clean and not busy, which creates a GREAT atmosphere for conversation. All the waitresses/waiters are very polite and well trained, I enjoy when the owner (or manager?) is there walking around and asking about your service. It feels like a family owned restaurant despite it being a chain.   The customer service is awesome! I came in directly after a knee surgery and the staff were extremely accommodating to me and my family.   My only complaint is the take out side. The last two times I ordered it was not good at all and sloppily thrown together. I'm hoping this gets better over time!!

Genghis Grill, after my 1st bad experience a year or so ago I swore I would never come back,,,but was at Tempe Marketplace with my daughter who said she was hungry and loves Genghis and since she was buying, she said that's where we are going. So I went, hesitant.   Walked in and it was a different experience this time! The floors & tabletops were not sticky and the counter top was clean.  I was starting to enjoy myself.  So started to make my bowl, I went with the festive chicken and steak, decided that I will follow whatever my heart desires, added a mix of sliced bell peppers and onions, then some mushrooms, jalapenos, pico de gallo (note to self, don't add that again, it has chopped baby corns which freak me out, cuz really were is corn growing only 3 inches long and as skinny as a pen), green onions, some cabbage? Tossed in some red chili flakes and hit it with more spice and fiery hot sauce before turning it over to the grill got it with some fried rice. That was some heaven right there, delish I tell you!!  The one who wound up cooking my food on the grill even told me man that looks and smells great!   Ok I can say I am glad to have gone back a 2nd time and most likely will be back again.

Went to Genghis Grill to redeem a free birthday bowl and this was my 1st time at this location, I have to say the set up inside is nice.    Went to go get my bowl made, and when I got their a young man asked me what types of meats I wanted, and he was serving them into the bowl, and I thought oh, this is different guess he is putting my bowl together for me, and after he placed the meat into the bowl then he gave the bowl to me to finish up with it, which I did, just wonder why I wasn't able to put my own meat in, because I would have added much less than what I got haha. Even though I am a carnivore, I do love my veggies and I just feel Genghis just doesn't offer much in the veggie department. But they do have Udon noddles which I happen to love!  My lunch bowl was good, service was friendly, and glad to stopped by and added them to my lunch time list!

Mediocre at best.   Food service is ok. Prices are high for what you get.   Waiter for drinks was bartender.  Can't get the guy to give us more sugar.  He's watching tv.   Music is okay.  Decor is good.

We crave places like this in our family. We have various family members who are vegetarian, don't eat red meat, need a gluten-free diet, or are simply uncertain what they want to eat. Genghis Grill is the choice we make for all of these situations. As noted before, if you don't like your bowl, it is your own damn fault, since you picked everything out.  The gluten-free ones appreciate the sauces which are without gluten (since the problem is greater than simply paying attention to the grain used in the starches). The ones who don't eat red meat are happy with the fresh chicken and seafood items for proteins. The vegetarians like the selection of fresh vegetables and sauces without meat.  Me? I am none of those above. I just like making a bowl the way I want it and eating a nice dinner. It might be a little louder inside than I would prefer, but not as bad as some other local spots.  The other night, three of us were $35 before tip, not including the two glasses of wine. That makes GG a little more expensive than Pei Wei, but in return there is the luxury of having everything the way one wants it, along with the knowledge of the ingredients which go into the bowl.

I've only been to a Mongolian Grill once, but this was my first time here. If you're a newbie like I was, the server explains what to do:  1. Choose the size of your bowl  Pile as high as you can -  2. Meats 3. Spices/seasoning 4. Veggies 5. Sauce(s)  6. Then bring your bowl to the grill area (be careful not to spill anything) 7. Wait for your dish to arrive!  It may seem a bit overwhelming at first since there's so many to choose from. But if you know what you typically like, and after sampling the different sauces, your bowl should come out tasty.  Everything was delicious, except my veggies seemed undercooked.  I recommend to mix your bowl before eating since majority of the sauce stays on the bottom, and get 2 sauce containers for a regular sized bowl (3+ for the large bowl).  The price is very very reasonable! The prices are around: Small = $10, Regular = $11.50, Large = $13 The serving size is HUGE!!!! A regular could feed me twice... And I eat a lot.  The service was average though. My party arrived 1hr before they closed (closing hours were earlier from what was noted in Yelp), so the server was in a bit of a hurry & we had to rush our stay. Nonetheless, we still had a good experience.  I'd definitely come back to create a different bowl!

FAITHFUL FAN   I am trying to get all of my friends off of YC's and on to this place- because it's AWESOME! Instead of gross frozen meat, Genghis Grill keeps all of their protein and veggies fresh. I don't eat meat, so I also appreciate that Genghis always has Shrimp, Calamari, Scallops, Marinated White Fish, and Krab Imitation for me to choose from :) They have a very wide selection of veggies and fruits, lots of seasons for spicing- and an delicious choice of sauces!! I probably try a new sauce everytime, and have never been disappointed! I also appreciate that they have marinara sauce and spiral noodles for my friends who are weary of asian food.  They also have AMAZING DRINK SPECIALS :) I had a two dollar mimosa this afternoon.  $1 Sake $2- Wells, Mimosas, Bud Light Drafts & Sweet tea Vodkas $3- Domestic Beers & Skyy Vodka $4- Bloody Marys, Import Beers $5- Sake Bombs and Jager Bombs..  They serve happy hour priced drinks all day Sunday-Thursday and Friday and Saturday until 7pm.  Definitely the place to get your cheap drink on at Tempe Marketplace.

Don't bother coming to this location. First, they have completely changed the menu.  They don't carry shrimp or scallops any longer.  But the manager feels pork is a good substitute.  Also, they are out of sausage at 7pm on Friday with a 1/2 empty restaurant. According to the manager, "they were just busy" though.  And to top it off, the manager is an argumentative ass when asked about it! IJS
The options are pretty good and they cook the food pretty damn quick. I'd definitely say this is s good place for lunch. They have a bar also which is nice. Staff is awesome as well.

The layout is simple.  Walk in, host greets you and seats you.  If you have not been there before then the server is flagged to come walk to through their process.  If not then you are off on our own.  Server came got our drink order and walked us through the process.  Our server Brittney was awesome!  We picked our meats, added spices, picked our veggies, and then sauces.  I got beef, chicken, garlic spice, tofu, baby corn, and water chestnuts.  I added the soy honey (too sweet for me).  I picked all of my stuff to go with udon noodles.  It was ok, was not the best I have ever had.    We also ordered a cheesecake for dessert.  It was good.    Later talking with the manager, Andrew.  They have been open for 2 months, they are still working out the processes of the place (understandable).

We have dined here many times and after eating lunch here today, I'm not sure I would go back.  Things seem to be going downhill. The sign on the front door said they were out of a few of their sauces, not a huge deal, but strange and we were at least informed before getting in line.  The area where you make your bowl wasn't well stocked and they were even completely out of a few things.  The sauce area was VERY messy and needed to be wiped down.  Nobody was behind the area to service it   We ate around 3pm, and eventhough they weren't busy, they were behind on the cooking of the bowls.  The whole cooking area looked dirty.  The hand washing sink next to the grill was broken and spurted water up onto the wall and caused the floor to be wet.  Used metal bowls and dropped food debris could be seen on the floor as well.  The whole place needed a cleaning and some repair work.  An upholstered booth seat was heavily torn and the black tape used to cover the holes had been there long enough that it was peeling up and almost gone.  Why not get something liked that fixed?  Even the edge of the red bowl my food was served in was chipped. Lunch for 2 with sodas was $40 including tip. The food tasted fine and the service was average, but the lack of cleanliness and normal maintenance makes me not want to return.

Genghis Grill was definitely an interesting experience. When you enter they give you a bowl which you fill up with meats, vegetables and other ingredients (hint: fill that bowl as high as possible because the meat will shrink). Afterwards you pick your sauces and your starch. They even bring it to your table when it's ready. For a price like $9.99 for a bowl you'll realize that it fills you up very quickly. I followed the beef and broccoli recipe and I ended up taking half of it home in leftovers which, by the way, taste even better when you eat them the next day.

Awesome place and great food!! Service was amazing and staff was very helpful and accommodating, been here with friends and with kids in different occasions. One of our go to spots when visiting the area! Do not miss out on some great food and great service.
Great place to go to with friends and coworkers in Tempe Marketplace.  Food quality and service is alway top notch!

I went here with a co-worker for lunch and it was fine. Not great, not bad... just what you would expect from a Mongolian grill restaurant. The service was exceptional. I strongly feel that the food was extremely overpriced. A small bowl during lunch hour with a soda and 18% tip will set you back over $16! WAY too much for a bowl of stir fry, in my opinion.

This place used to be my favorite in town. However since i first started going there they have frequently upped the prices while making the portions smaller. Great quality and selection food-wise, but a bit pricey...

This was the worst meal I have ever had from a restaraunt. The guy on the grill was fussing at the other employees the whole time I was there and the food was terrible. I would  stand around and watch for someone to finish eating something else, then take over there plate, before I would eat here again.

Not good!  If you love Genghis Grill, do not go to this one.  The quality compared to Tempe Marketplace is by far much lower.  They only have a third of the vegetable choices and they won't even let you make your own sauce. The rice was stale and the worst part is they pre cooked the chicken. Awful just awful.  Now, I go to Genghis enough that I make the same meticulous bowl every time. It's awesome by the way. But this place practically made my bowl the way they wanted it and it was awful. I'm pretty particular about my Genghis.  I will say the service was very good but the quality was not.

I was having a lovely dinner until the server decided to ignore us . He kept chatting with the bar staff and cooks. We saw the server for the table next to us pass by like 10 times and ours would never come back. Next time I will get a to go order because I will be back for the steak!

Not what I'm used to for Mongolian food. The meat was pre-cooked (I'm used to the frozen stuff) which I felt didn't pick up the sauces flavor. One of the charms of mongolian is mixing your own sauces to create something unique for yourself. Think you can do that here? Absolutely not. Being used to pouring my own sauces I grabbed the ladle to get my sauce which was ripped out of my hand and explained they don't put sauces on the grill.   At our table they had little tablets where you could purchase games and actually check out and pay for your meal. Even with the option of splitting the bill. Do you think that service worked? Absolutely not. We tried splitting the bill where only one person got to pay using the device, my bill wouldn't go through, my best friends bill only partly paid. We asked for assistance and no one knew how to fix it. It's a great idea that just wasn't executed.   If you're looking for true, yummy, make your own Mongolian.... keep driving past this place.

This was the first time I tried Mongolian food and I'm glad that it was Ghengis grill! I just loved the food..I liked the idea of customizing your bowl and it is cooked right in front of you! I just made random guess of sauces and it turned out to be yummy..and the waitress was kind enough to consider ASU discount after the billing..Can't wait to visit Ghengis again!

Totally love their fun mongolian establishment! It is self serve, but they've got all the cool stuff, and an extensive selection of ingredients to choose from! So much you'd be so undecided on what to choose. So...after coming here a few times already, here's my advice:  1.) THE DREADED SILVER PLATE: They give you a silver plate which looks really small and depressing because halfway through filling your silver plate with stuff, you realize that the silver bowl is wwwaaaaayyyy too small, and you'll learn that really quick once you get your cooked food since they all shrink down to size after being cooked. MY SUGGESTION: pile high. no joke. PILE HIGH. don't be shameful. don't second guess. Yess....this is your game of jenga or tetris with food. Pile as high as you can. If you have to smush with your hands do it (it's not a crime to pile high nor is it a crime to take your time, people can go around you...).   2.) TASTE TEST YOUR FLAVORS! You can taste as much sauces as you'd like, and you can mix them. If you're not sure try them, and! The fun labels tell you EXACTLY what it pairs well with.   3.) INDECISIVE? DON'T KNOW WHERE TO START? No worries, in the beginning of the line they have fun recipe cards you can use and to help you start so then if you're looking to put in your flavor...you can play around with it. Think of it as an inspiration card.  4.) CHOOSE YOUR STARCH: I usually go with the brown rice. I love that that they have brown rice and I'm sure you healthy eaters will too. Think it's not enough? You can request for double!  5.) SELF SERVE COKE MACHINE: High five selling coke products, but even more of a high five for having that cool new digital coke machine! Mix and match every flavor known to man! You'll be sure to be indecisive in a drink here too.  6.) SUPER COOL TOUCH PAD: Here, you can split your tap with your lunch date and fun touch pad games while waiting.  **I love that this brings an opportunity to just get creative. You can be really interactive with it.  It does get busy during lunch, and the wait does take some time, so if you're in during your lunch break, expect that your meal won't come out in time for you to get back to the office.
Freshly made, big portions and great taste. Ohh almost forgot, cost less than the bottle of water and chips I purchased at the Cancun airport for $10.

never going back! they're chefs cannot cook. although I did enjoy the whole concept of building your own dish.  The staff was terrible as well. They had no personality, and showed little interest to my dinning needs. DON'T GO HERE!
Service was good and the recipe cards were helpful for someone who hasn't been there before and isn't sure what to put in their bowl!

Kendrick was very friendly. Talkative. However the service has  really declined.  The staff was more interested in their conversations than talking to customers. And the bartender was rude.  If you are gonna raise your prices provide good customer service.

Initial Impression and experience: So I have always loved Mongolian BBQ. I've dined at many in CA over the years, and this is the first one I've been to here in NV. When we walked up we were greeted outside the door and followed in to be seated right away. That was nice. We were sat at a table and told out waiter would be right with us. He came over and asked if we had ever been there. We said no, so he explained how it all works. Pretty easy to figure out, but whatever, we listened anyway. We got up and went to the food counter. All the food looked fresh and crisp. It was a little difficult to reach some of the items in the back because of the very low sneeze guard. The bowl they give you is VERY small, so everything you try to overstack falls off  :/ We watched them cook our food for a minute, and they came over to let us know our appetizer was on the table for us. So we went over to sit and eat.  Service: Service was on the a lot to be desired side. We each had a drink and they never refilled them for us. They actually took my boyfriends cup (like they were going to refill it) but never brought it back. They listened to my 13 year son over me on whether or not he was going to get all you can eat and brought him a second bowl to fill up anyway. I had to again tell them no, we are not getting all you can eat.  Food: The food was fresh and very good sauces and spices were available.  Price: TOO EXPENSIVE. There were 3 of us and we each got 1 bowl, an appetizer to share, and each a drink and we spent over $50. Too much to pay if you don't even end up with some left overs to take home. The price would have been fine if it was all you can eat that we did, but not for 1 tiny bowl.  Overall: We enjoyed the food a lot, but there wasn't enough and it was too expensive. I would go back, but not for the price. Like another person said, it's almost double what you would pay in CA for the same thing. You can even get close to this same type of food at any buffet here is Vegas and pay less, but have other options as well. I really liked the food and would love to go back, but only if they drop their prices.

I am brainwashed into thinking that airport being in an airport means "eat bad Chinese food ".  I went on a search for Manchu Wok and was pleasantly surprised to find the Genghis Grill.   Made in Mongolian Style (huge flat wok), the dishes  have a good amount of meet and fresh vegetables.  I was glad to have some stir fried rather than deep fried Chinese food. I hope this chain spreads to more airports.

I've been here a few times and I could never make my dish good. Recently though, it finally came out well and I've been returning ever since! We were waiting for our movie to start and decided to get a few drinks. Customer service has always been good to me. We ended up just getting some drinks, saki, and pot stickers. You can't go wrong with their happy hour its really not that bad. I can definitely see myself coming back here!
This food was AMAZIN!  I recommend the red curry sauce w cayenne pepper for a little kick *
I wish they didn't close the one location we have in Illinois. I love this place for the variety. You are your own chef. You choose your own ingredients, so only you can really mess it up!

The cook, aka, my son, told us he was on the grill and he said, "you guy's can come by if you want, I'm getting pretty good at cooking."    Well, two things struck me, the fact he said we could come by and that he was getting better at cooking raw meat .  Seriously,  he's excellent at it and he did a great job with our food (5/5).  It's no longer endless trips to the food bar though.  There's 3 bowl sizes and you have a variety of raw meats, seafoods,  veggies, and sauces to pick from.  You place the meat and veggies as high as you can and place the sauces on the side.  If it's slow enough load veggies first and then the heavier raw meats or seafood.  My fav sauces are honey soy and mongo bbq (5/5).  Service is great (5/5) and ambiance is too albeit it is not Asian motif (5/5).  WatchIng them cook up the food with the wooden sticks is cool too.   It's a great experience!

Good thing about this place is that you can get fresh veggies, freshly cooked. The taste is just too sweet for my taste. So no point of having fresh veggies sugar loaded.  The price is a little high too compared to serving size and taste.

Not sure what has happened to this place... I was there with my hubby on Friday night and noticed raw ship mixed in with the cold imitation crab.  Typically the imitation crab can be eaten cold.  My concern is that raw seafood cannot ever sit in a bowl of food that people are going to eat raw.  There is cross cantamition with this situation.  I pointed it out to the staff and a staff member pulled out the raw shrimp but left the crab for others to eat. I explained the situation to the Manager as I'm sure there is no harm intended but you have to educate your workers about cross contimation - I stick with tofu at this place.  Not one of my faves anymore - and the language coming from the cooks can make a Sailor blush - loud F bombs and I just chose not to hear that during a dinner that is meant to be relaxing.
Good. Fast. fresh. Borderline pricey. Inconsistent customer service. You can eat - paleo, primal, veg, or fatty.

After hearing friends rave about how great this place is we gave it a try fo lunch last Sunday. What a mistake.  I guess I'm spoiled, backin Chicago we had a great Mongolian BBQ place where the food was excellent as was the service. The service we received here was good, but the quality of the food isn't. I made my own bowl qhile my partner ordered the Korean tacos. He couldn't tell me enough how much he disliked it and he is very easy going and forgiving when it comes to restaurants.  My bowl was devoid of flavor due to the minimal amount of sauce they give you. Keep in mind I gave them an idea of what I wanted and they assisted me since it was my first (and last) visit.   This is just another average chain restaurant with below average food.

This is the only Mongolian bbq place I know of and in the past it was very good. We put little seasoning and sauce but still very salty. I don't know if I'll be back. There's nothing like the ones in California!
I have eaten at this location several times.  The food is delicious!  Well worth the price.  The daytime staff is great, but the evening staff is incompetent and lousy!!!

Love, love, love their fun Mongolian establishment! It's self-serve and build your own meal, but they've got all the cool stuff, and an extensive selection of ingredients to choose from! So much you'd be so undecided on what to choose. Was in town visiting family and ended up coming TWICE! Here is my take and how why both visits are worthy of a rare 5 star:  1.) THE MEAT: This is one of the best parts. From what I recall, they have Chicken, Spicy Chicken, Fish, Steak, Beef, Bacon, Pepperoni, Crab, Eggs, and a few other things that I forget. Everything looked very fresh!   2.) TASTE TEST YOUR FLAVORS! You can taste as many sauces as you'd like, and you can mix them. If you're not sure try them! This is not your typical Mongolian, they have sauces like Kung Pao and Teriyaki which is all you really need if you want that type of a dish.  3.) INDECISIVE? DON'T KNOW WHERE TO START? No worries. In the beginning of the line, they have fun recipe cards you can use and to help you start so then if you're looking to put in your flavor...you can play around with it. Think of it as an inspiration card.  4.) CHOOSE YOUR STARCH: I usually go with the brown rice. I love that that they have brown rice and I'm sure you healthy eaters will too. Think it's not enough? You can get it on cabbage as well to be extra lean!  5.) SUPER COOL TOUCH PAD: Here, you can split your tab with your lunch date and fun touch pad games while waiting. You can order drinks which we did one night during dinner; it was delivered FAST!  **I love that this brings an opportunity to just get creative. You can be really interactive with it. The place has a great ambiance to hang out and have fun! We will be back anytime we are in AZ.

I came into the restaurant two days ago, a Friday night. The line was long so we thought we would get an appetizer. The waitress said the potstickers we were looking at were amazing. We ordered the potstickers and they looked nothing like the menu! They came out white, they looked boiled and not fried at all. It was disappointing to come back to the table to 5 potstickers that were horrible looking and cost $7! At least my noodle bowl came out good.  I suggest passing on the appetizers and people just ordering the noodle bowls

This location used to be one of our favorite places to eat in the area. However the last two times err have been in the smell was so bad that we had to leave. Today it smelled just like wet dog, and the floor was so sticky it was worse than the worst movie theater I have ever been in. This place has some cleaning issues they need to address in the front of house.

How is it that a place as amazing as Genghis Grill is going to allow a dirty 20 something kid cook for them. As i watched him cooking my food he takes his ball cap off and runs his handa through his hair right over my food. Ive never been so disgusted. The manager and his half ass attempt to fix it asks me what i wanted him to do. My honest answer was "send him home, hes just contaminated the entire cooking area by being a filthy man."Manager kinda tucked tail and allowed this filthy cook to yell at him. I will NEVER recommend this place to anyone. You want good Genghis Grill then do yourself a huge favor and go to the one at Tempe Market Place.

We've now been to this restaurant 4 times and it just stays fairly bad. We've talked to management and get excuses and statements like, "oh, we're just really busy", "we're still training", etc. The quality of the ingredients is really good and the service is pretty good, too. Where this place falls down is the cooking. They just can't seem to get the concept that the bowls need to be placed on the grill in the order they arrive and come off in that order, too. Three of the four times we've been I've had burnt food because the cooks are standing around talking or horsing around lighting the grill. If you've ever been to a real Mongolian BBQ I think you will be disappointed in this place. We're hoping somebody recognizes the potential and opens up a good one!

Really good, fast, and can be super healthy' or not.  Its a build it yourself place, so if you don't know what to make for yourself, ask.   Expected a fast food style place, definitely not, in a good way.

Genghis Grill has figured out a way for their servers to do absolutely nothing. Already there was no real "kitchen" for them to maneuver, and now they don't even serve water...you get it yourself. They were also out of straws on the day I recently went. Really? You're completely out of STRAWS? Not even for the fishbowl drinks you have? That's a mark of poor management not keeping simple necessities like straws in order.   I was sort of in a love affair with Genghis Grill when I first moved here, but really, it is not that good. They have cut so many corners since then that it's not even fun to eat here. I want full baby corns, dammit, not cut up that I can barely taste it or get it on my fork.   I would rather have Panda Express or Pei Wei than this crapola. Pass.

Met some friends here today and this was my first visit. I wasn't sure what to expect, but I like that we had a server who explained the process. She brought three different sized bowls (small, medium and large). We also got cards with our names and size of our bowls on each card. I picked a large because it didn't seem that big at first...  Went to the bar which had lots of meat choices including steak, chicken and fish. Meat was the  first stop too, so we could pile it on! Yum! Added some spices (maybe a little too many), veggies and sauce. It was so fun!!! Handed it off to the cooking station and our server brought out the cooked portion. After adding the rice (my startch choice), the bowl became huge! Lol I had to use two to-go containers to take home my leftovers!
Pretty terrible food! I had the special fried rice and it was flavorless and the chicken tasted stale. I don't expect anything amazing at an airport but this was sub par by any scale.

We were greeted as we entered, and sat immediately.  The waitress was nice enough to explain to my fiancee how this restaurant works - 1.) order off of the menu, 2.) pick what you want in your bowl of a listed menu and have them make it for you, or 3.) head on up to the buffet bar and pick all your own items to go into your bowl.  We decided to head up to the bar so we could be hands on with our experience. The food looked fresh and it was hard to decide between all the options! Once all your decisions are made (protein, veggie, sauce, etc.) you can take your bowl over to the very large, round grill for the staff to cook it up and brought to your table.  Overall: A If we are over in that area, I'm sure we will be back.

I've been here twice before, most recently 4 months ago. We really liked it as a standard Mongolian BBQ. However, I went last night and was disappointed. They've switched to small, med, and large bowl options which is an OK idea, but the small is $8.99 and TINY. All of the handles for scoop ingredients were filthy and sticky up to the tips of the handles. They added tasting spoons for sauces (again good idea), but the flavors of the sauces were lacking and homogeneous, with many being honey-something or other. Someone mentioned new owners, which may explain the changes.  The only high point was our waitress, Victoria I believe, who was amazing! However, her awesome serving skills weren't enough for me to plan to come back.

As far as airport food goes, this was not a bad option. It's certainly not a normal Mongolian BBQ place because that's just not feasible in an airport. But they had great menu options and the cashier even made it a point to ask every single customer if they had any food allergies. For the gluten-free crowd, they have several soy-sauce substitutes available, so you don't have to limit yourself to just the curry options.  If this had not been in an airport, I might not have been so generous with my rating. However, it was an excellent airport option.

Glad to see a decent Mongolian grill choice in south Charlotte.  Food was good (although highly dependent on your skill at mixing and matching ingredients - they do try to help by giving some recipe cards to follow).  Service was good.  All in all a decent option for a fun and reasonable meal in the Ballantyne area.

So why would you beat up on a brand new place. obviously these are younger folks just trying to make money by starting here and you folks just throw them under the bus. This is not rocket science  but they do have some highly edumacated folks there. Yes they are a chain but yes this is new store. The concept is sound, the food is fresh and clean and only bad because you cant figure out how to season it. That is the whole concept. I sit at full service bar and am treated like king with my named asked for and used several times. Drink and food club stuff avail. All you can eat for 14.00 is cheap. If you dont know how to fill one bowl to the max and dont understand how meat shrinks when you cook it then pay the extra 3 bucks cheapass. I have been waiting for good Mongo since that place went TU on Flamingo near UNLV.  Give these guys a chance, ask questions the first time you are there, they will gladly help you out. Most of all give immediate common sence feedback on table size and such so they can at least look into improveing your crummy little life experience. Dont just go once, like it but whine about it!

This place was great at one time, all you could eat for a fair price, then it went to pay extra for all you can eat, and then to three bowl sizes. The large bowl that you pick your items in used to be much bigger than the next size bowl. Was in today and the large bowl was the same size as the regular bowl, when I asked about this was told bowl was the large. In the past my meats would feel one box and the rice in a separate box but tonight it all fit in one box with lots of room. Genghis is getting so cheep, I don't think I will be back....

I was very impressed. This is the best Mongolian grill I have been to so far.  A lot of people seem to be complaining about the fans and the way you have to put together your own recipe....and I don't get that. We live in Phoenix, the fans were quite welcome; and there are racks of recipe "cheat sheets" if you aren't creative or your culinary aptitude is nil.  That being said, I was thoroughly impressed with the selection of all ingredients--particularly the array of spices and sauces to choose from. The "3G sauce" as it was called if I remember correctly, is recommended highly.   Like others have said, a bottomless bowl is definitely not necessary, one bowl was more than enough. Also, they have bottled domestic beers for only $1 all day every day last time I was in, so get down on that, why not. Two beers cost me less than my friend's coke.  This place deserves a higher rating, give it a try.

Food was really good with fresh ingredients. price is a little high so make sure you fill your bowl completely to get what you pay for. it was our first time and a little confusing so try to go with someone who has been before.

Haven't been here in awhile. While it is a pick and choose kind of set up it has been much improved since I was last here. Being able to pay at your table is a nice convenience.  Also ordering drinks, appetizers,  etc is great. Enjoyed the meal and pretty satisfied.

I consider this a lunch spot, I don't think I would come here for dinner.  I also wouldn't ever pay full price to eat at Genghis Grill.  If you plan on eating here, I suggest signing up for their club to get your free regular size birthday bowl and other coupons via email, plus every 10th bowl free.  This restaurant falls somewhere between fast food and full service.  You are seated by a hostess, but a while back they changed it so you get your own beverages (Coke Freestyle machines), and you go down a buffet style line to pick your bowl ingredients, but you order appetizers and bar drinks from a server.  I really had to get over my fear of going down a buffet line of raw proteins (chicken, beef, pork, fish, etc.).  It scared me because of possible cross contamination, salmonella, temperature, etc.  After coming here on multiple occasions and not getting sick, my anxiety has lessened a bit, but I remain very careful.    Some tips: Make sure you season your meat or your bowl will be bland.  Pile your veggies high because they will cook down.  You can add egg to your bowl when you order your starch.  You can also pick up some toppings (peanuts, sesame seeds, chow mein noodles, and chili paste) while there.

I had lunch here the other day, and I have to say it was pretty good. My only other experience with Mongollean style stir fry has been YC's. And I used to find that with YC's no matter what "sauces" you used in preparing your meal, it always tasted the same.   At Genghis, I fixed up my meal following the direction for Thai Chicken, and it came out tasting like Thai Chicken... with a nice little kick.   The lunch portions are good. And the server actually walks you through the whole process if it's your first trip.  HUGE selection of different ingredients and topping and sauces. You can follow on of the many "recipes" or create your own.   I will be back to give this place another go!

Awful! Rude waiters, dirty dishes, served lettuce wraps with holy butter lettuce with hot meat on them?! 2 regrets, that I didn't check Yelp reviews first & honestly, I would have been happier with Arby's next door!!

Genghis Grill is a great idea I wish we had one in NY!  I love the idea of making your own bowl and making it whatever you want it to be from the different meats, vegetables, spice, sauces, and starch you want.  For people who have trouble making choices they have cards you can follow to help you.  The food was very fresh and they cooked well.  I would recommend this place to anyone who loves any kind of stir fry. The combinations are endless!  Price is very good too!  The place was very clean and I like the building.  One thing I wasn't sure of was if they have wifi.
Great place to eat. Awesome variety of meats & veges makes for a great way to customize your bowl with all your faves. My new favorite place to eat!

Welcome to the epitome of Americanized Asian food. Ham? Pepperoni? Maybe for the confused. And the sauces - the god awful sauces I could probably buy in an overpriced bottle in the "Asian" section of Safeway. They were loaded with too much sugar. I tried the "Mongolian BBQ sauce" which was really actually cleverly disguised Texan BBQ sauce - lots of cumin in it and pretty much devoid of Asian flavors like hoisin and sesame oils. I also tried the Dragon sauce and teriyaki. Both loaded with sugar.   On top, the bowl they give you for your toppings seems pretty tiny. I couldn't pack the meat plus the vegetables I wanted. The actual bowl that is served is huge because they load it with noodles. The ratio should have more vegetables like cabbage and bean sprouts and lower on the noodles.   Oh, you can also get your BBQ wrapped in a burrito too. OK.  At least service was good? Pretty much it's only saving factor. I'm pretty sure Panda Express has less sugar, and at least their food doesn't consist of pepperoni (Truth: I love Panda Express). The fact that this people think this is Asian food makes me die inside a little.

I've been to Genghis twice and the first time was very lack luster.. I was going to give a 2 or 3 star review but after my second encounter I decided to up the ante to a 4 star. The food is traditional Mongolian BBQ in that you get a small bowl which you skillfull try to stuff as much ingredients into then have them cook it for you either over noodles or rice. Sauce included or on the side. The sides are good I love that they have bok choy  which you dont often see on many Mongolian BBQ's. They try hard to keep the area clean and usually succeed. The only complaint I have is that maybe the people cooking need a lil more training.. sometime the food sits a lil too long on the grill .. just my preference I suppose..  Its decent.. I'll definitely be back.

First time eating here the people is very friendly and helpful .. Very clean so are the restrooms .. You pick how you want your food .. Very good selection to choose from .. And the dessert omg beautiful ! I will come back two thumbs up

So we have been going to Genghis for the last 7 years, It has made some changes through the years..the most recent is their is no ALL YOU CAN EAT BOWL, Let me tell you the males in my family miss that. They have Small, Med and Large bowls now. The large is big, bigger than your eyes think, so big I even had leftovers to take home. The concept is that of a Mongolian barbecue in which you place the Proteins, which there are about 8 of, in the bowl, add dry spices, veggies, wet sauces and then bring it to the huge flat grill where the cooks will stir fry it with your choice of a carb ( rice, noodles, cabbage, or tortillas). It would be so nice if you could have all the ingredients they carry in your fridge at all times, but since they don't this is wonderful. They have cut back on some of the fillings but its still such a great flavor profile that you end up craving it! Fill your bowl and ask for a raw egg to be added to it when you get to the grill, believe me it is so good!!

We end up here about once a month. The food is good and I like the idea of choosing my own ingredients and flavors. I am bothered, though, that the service is consistently blah. I don't know what is happening with staff, but something is bringing them down.

This place is awesome. I am a huge fan of Mongolian barbecues and this place is no exception. The server was ultra friendly, the ingredients looked pretty fresh, and there are instructions for you non-veterans to Mongolian bbq. So after overfilling my bowl with an assortment of goods, I sat down and 5 minutes later the raw food became hot and delicious stir-fry. I'm definitely coming back here for sure.

So cool! Reminds me of place in Cleveland called Mongolian BBQ!  Bestie took me here after a long delicious night.  Never been here before so good and Yumma and fun!! And it is my friends birthday but we did not sign up in time for a free birthday bowl which we noticed was an option on the iPad menu on our table but our server Mia was AMAZING

Turned on to this place by a friend. When I walked in, immediately reminded me of Pei Wei. Seems like the same kind of concept, but you build your meal yourself.  If you don't come with someone who has experienced this place before, you could wind up skimping yourself on your meal. You are responsible for either building your dream bowl, or you can select from a few recommended templates. But, if you don't take into consideration that your meal will shrink drastically once it is fully cooked, your overstuffed precooked bowl comes to your table cooked and barely half the size it was before. I've even stacked to the point of carrying my bowl to the cooking station covering the edges with my hands to keep it all in and still got back a very small cooked portion.  All in all, the food tastes great, better yet, awesome, you just don't get a lot of bang for your buck and it's a pretty steep buck. But I give them brownie points for serving Coke Zero!

So I come here very often and it has gotten better every time. Not sure if that's my skill level at stacking my bowl or the flavors they offer in the selections. I have so much good to say about this place from the staff to the food to the atmosphere always showing espn on every screen big plus for me. I would say that I love how u just have to ask for shrimp and they add at the grill only minus is they are some ver small shrimp. Also I'm not a fan of being sat right by the entrance door when there are seats available all through out. But that doesn't outweigh the deliciousness of the meal. Being able to put as much as u can in a bowl recreating the leaning tower of pizza is the goal and they encourage it. Your pretty much the chef and what u choose to be in your food is what your going to eat so don't be bashful. Overall an amazing experience for adults and children alike!! I'll always come
Great fun and great food. Added egg. Yesss they still do that. Chicken potstickers are the bomb. Love this place....MJ

I love this place. Meats and spices and veggies, all cooked how I like them. I often do gluten free, and often feel picky and stingy when asking servers to alter stuff and its nice having it my way from the get go.

Went here while waiting for my friend to get off work on a weekday which is cool because they have lunch menu and a dinner menu.   I ordered three large bowl and loaded it up. Only reason I didn't give it 5 stars because I feel like they can have more options of vegetables to put in your bowl. Other than that great service great beverage station and food was very good and came out fast !

Basically you serve yourself by putting different meats, veggies, spices, and other ingredients in a bowl and then they cook it for you on a giant grill. I took my vegan brother and his wife there since they could just mix vegetables. Decently priced and you can never make the same thing twice. The food kind of tastes like Mongolian bbq.

I have been here about four times and I would like to finally write a great review! Genghis Grill is a very inviting place with a laid back atmosphere. The restaurant is clean and the staff is very friendly. The quality of the food is very good and the final product is delicious. They have cards that will help you achieve the flavor you are looking for and they have a wide variety of vegetables, meats, and seasonings. I will be back because it is the closest thing to "Hu Hot Mongolian Grill" that is located in the midwest.

Yes. Just, yes.   Basically you choose whether you want a Small, Medium, or Large bowl. Take that bowl through a self serve buffet station filled with; various protein options, spices, produce & sauces. Once you make it to the end, someone will be waiting to cook your food along with your choice of rice, or noodles. When your food is cooked, your server will deliver it to your table. Eat & enjoy.  Genghis grill is fantastic! You can't really complain about the food, because you literally build your own stir-fry. The selection in the little buffet thingy is great!   The only complaint is that their drinks are too expensive. We arrived during happy hour & I ordered the $4 Bloody Mary that was on special, & it was disappointingly small. My boyfriend drank Bud Light, which was still $4.50 per 12 oz. glass.

My fiance and I were out running errands around town this past weekend and passed by this place.  I mentioned wanting to try it sometime and that I had been to a place with the same concept many years ago in Tempe and thought it was really cool.  After we were done running errands we were headed back the same direction and came up to Ghenghis and he pulled in the parking lot and suggested we go ahead and try it.  We walk in and wait to be seated like the sign says, right off the bat I notice several employees walk by without even acknowledging us.  Then this male employee walks over with a bewildered look on his face, like he clearly is not used to seating people.  I thought he'd figure it out since it's not exactly a large restaurant.  We should have just grabbed a seat at their bar!  He told us someone would be right with us and a girl came over and sat us...right next to the server station.  Whatever I was starving and didn't really care at that time.  Neither one of us had been there so our waitress who sat us rapidly explained the process, she went thru it so fast I just decided we should fill out their form and have them make our bowls for us.  When she got back to us for our order we ordered drinks, I got a coke and he ordered a beer.  We proceeded to sit there for about 20 minutes, meanwhile at the table next to us some people sat down after us and were brought their meals and were almost done!  Our waitress comes over and says our food should be out any minute, not long after that another woman comes over ( I assume the manager since she wasn't wearing a server uniform) and says that they are out of two of the seafood items that my fiance had ordered.  He changed his order and we continued to wait all the while thinking why the hell didn't they tell us that in the first place!  Then as we waited and waited some more I started wondering why our waitress said our food should be out soon when they clearly hadn't even started cooking it yet if they didn't even possess the food to cook it.  By this point I was extremely hungry and irritated, I had half a coke left his beer was empty and the waitress comes by and drops off a fresh coke that I felt like she did only to try and make up for our wait.  But maybe she should have thought of asking if my fiance wanted another beer since his was empty!  She did stop to ask if they had told us they were out of his order and said she would take our bowls off, whatever that meant.  We continued to wait a few more minutes until I just couldn't wait any longer.  We got up to leave and walked passed the manager lady sitting at a bar table who said thanks for coming...ya thanks for NOTHING!  They weren't even what I would call busy.  I have never had to walk out on service like that.  I was looking forward to a cool new experience and ended up being extremely disappointed.  I will never go there again!

I've eaten at Genghis Grill many times and always loved the food. This last visit was exceptionally great. Our appetizer took a bit longer than it should have and our waiter, John, didn't miss a beat to take it off our bill and apologize (we hadn't even noticed it took awhile and insisted it was fine), we enjoyed the delicious appetizer on the house, our custom lunch bowls, and then we ordered the hazelnut pretzel wontons for desert. The kitchen was short on prepared wontons for the dish so John comped the desert from our bill as well. I work at a restaurant and know many things can go wrong unexpectedly. John was amazing at keeping us updated and happy during our visit! We definitely plan on becoming regulars of his!
Great place to eat and chill for a little. Seevice was fast and a very friendly staff plus great food.  Area clean and music wasn't over bearing and facility was very clean.  I will be xoming back
Appetizers never got made, brought wrong bowls to the table, they didn't explain how things worked... Very disappointing for a first visit, will not be back!

First time here & my best friend & I loved it. We were a little scared at first because we didn't know how much to add of the meats, veggies, & seasoning, but our amazing server Andie walked us through the process! Will definitely return here again!

My low review it's about the service I received today (06/16) and about our waiter Hayley, my food was great and I don't have any complaints about food value or flavor.  I met my family for dinner at Genghis, I have a young niece that had pizza and a kids drink from some other place for dinner; sometimes we get her Mac & Cheese but today she wanted pizza. We ordered our plates and drinks and by the time the bowl came to the table I basically had to "guess" if my bowl was my bowl because the waiter said the cooks had lost the name tag/receipt/little piece of paper with my name (no biggie it was my plate anyhow) I just found it inconvenient, what if it wasn't? That was problem #1  Problem #2 (and most important) We ate, we ordered separate checks and when mine comes it had a "Kids drink on it" I found it odd, but I was sure If I told my waiter she could take care of it. When she came and took the cards to process payment I said "I believe you charged me for the kids drink but we brought that for her (my niece) from the pizza place" the she says "But you were putting soda on the cup RIGHT?!?(with a very accusatory tone)  so I replied "Yes?!?! (very confused)" This because YES I did put soda on my niece's cup very small cup maybe HALF cup because she finished her soda and my boyfriend SHARED his soda with her on her cup. So this mean she either was spying on us or somehow knew that I shared half cup of soda with my niece which I find very interesting and lame to be honest, to be watching what your customers do or don't. Actually I was also sharing my bowl with my boyfriend, am I going to be double charged because we shared the bowl??  Hayley (and I'm assuming this was her name because it was on the receipt) then explained to me that since it's free refills it's charged by each person so that's why I was charged since I was putting soda on another cup. She asked if it was ok to which I replied "Yeah that's fine" and proceed to pay $1.50 for sharing my drink with a kid. I mean, she already assumed and made me feel like I was stealing soda by sharing 1/2 cup so what could I do other than pay, RIGHT?!??!  Very disappointing experience since we are paying $40+ dlls to eat there I think $1.50 could've been spared, we even left a full refilled cup of soda that wasn't needed or consumed that I'm sure it went to waste. It's not that I was stealing the forks or any valuables, I mean you guys would've known since you were very attentive to what I was doing.   Anyways, problem #3, the floor is very sticky.

It's difficult to rank a place like Genghis Grill for it's food, since you are the one choosing the ingredients, deciding how much sauce is in the bowl, etc. So it may be that I made some poor choices to result in the just-okay meal I had.   Once seated, you take a little slip of paper that you bring to the BYOB (build your own bowl) counter, which dictates how much stuff you can put in your bowl. The person manning the station was super helpful, giving us tips on what the sauces were like. I also loved that you get fined if you move backwards down the line. They didn't say why, but i saw that the bar went from chicken to beef to fish to veggies (Yay food safety!)   Because of how I built my bowl, there wasn't too much sauce, which I was a bit sad about. The flavors were good (get the spicy beef!), though the "udon" noodles weren't quite right-I was so excited because I love udon, but this wasn't real udon. That was the most disappointing part :(

This place was recommended by my cousin when I was visiting him on his end of town. So me and my wife went to try it out. We were greeted as soon as we came through the door. They explained how it works because it was our first time there. You get 2 metal bowls the small one is for your sauce. They have cards to tell you how to fix some bowls that are very easy to follow. Now it's time to load your bowl up. The first station you get to is the meat section, they had chicken, beef, pork, fish, scallops, calamari, etc... The next section is the season section. They have little spoons so you can sample the seasons and the sauces. The next section is the fruit section, the next section is the vegetable section. They have a wide variety of veggies: broccoli, string beans, tomatoes, onions, green onions, carrots, mushrooms, bean sprouts, spinach, etc....The next station is the sauces also a wide variety. Then your last stop is the grill where you tell the cook what starch you want, steamed rice, fried rice, brown rice, udon noodles, spiral pasta or tortillas. He gives you a card and you take it with you and place it in the holder they have on the table where you were seated. Then they stir fry it. The thing I love the most is your food comes straight to you hot off the grill. That stir fry was so good. The watermelon/lemonade was good too.

The best thing about this place is the different sauces. I wasn't impressed with how the meat is served (turned into something like hamburger on the grill). I also expected an all you can eat experience, trying different combos along the way, but at an extra $5 that makes dinner 14.99 before drinks, not what I expected from a place like this.

Very disappointed. Went there on a Saturday night. They said the were down 2 chefs. It took 20 mins to get thru the food line then 35 mins for our food to come out. The food was hot so that's why I gave a 1 star. I'll never visit this place again. I'd rather go to YCs

Ghengis is amazing! Used to come here all the time for lunch but then I switched jobs so this was the first time back in a while. One thing I noticed is that bowls seem to have gotten a little more expensive, $13 for a small bowl&  almost $15 for a big bowl. Crazy. But the concept is still great, love putting together your own bowl.

This was suppose to be my first time eating at this establishment! I have heard great things about this place, so of course I wanted to try it. Well this was a short stop. My boyfriend & I came in and were kindly greeted by the host and sat us down. :) Perfect. Welp, as a first-timer I didn't know what to do,. 10 minutes went by & we weren't acknowledged by a single waiter/waitress. A whole 10 minutes on what was a slow evening. 2 couples came in after us and were treated RIGHT away! Me and my boyfriend ended up getting fed up on how horrible service we were provided with! Not a good 1st impression!

I'll make this short and to the point.  YC's is good for a Mongolian grill but Genghis is much better.  The quality of meat alone is a reason to choose Genghis over YC's.  BTW they serve alcohol as well!  -d

The first time I came here, I  want overly impressed but my parents were wanting something a bit different. So we have Genghis a shot. I have to admit they have made improvements. Mongolian BBQs are becoming difficult to find so this is a fun experience.

I've been to this place in Phoenix and I was super psyched when one opened in Las Vegas! I'm glad it's here but it's not my favorite. I eat here about twice a month anyway because it's an easy way to get your veggies and it's cheap.  You go in, sit down, order your drink and get a bowl. Then you belly up to the bar and fix your own bowl. Drop it at the grill and your server delivers it to your table when it is ready.   THE BAD:  The bar is usually dirty which freaks me out. I know it's hard to keep the place clean but geez, sometimes it is downright nasty. The cooks also NEVER cook my bowls enough. I ask for it super well done / almost blackened and every single time my shrimp comes out opaque and I have to tell 'em to cook it more. I also experience tummy issues an hour or so after eating here...maybe from all the fiber? I don't know.   Another thing I really hate is that EVERY SINGLE TIME I have eaten here, the server has felt the need to comment on how many bowls I've eaten. We've had probably 8 different waiters and they all say something about it. I'm not fat (and there's nothing wrong with being chunky) but I can eat, and it makes me really uncomfortable when people feel like they have to say things like "wow, this is your THIRD BOWL?" Maybe corporate teaches them to do that so they will shame you into not getting another plate of shrimp. (And by the way, my bowls are usually 100% veggies; I don't like that meat that swims in its own...juices on the bar)!   THE GOOD:  You can pile on all the meat and veggies you want. It's fun to play chef and create a bowl with all the different dry spices and wet sauces. I usually pay the additional $3 to add on the all-you-can-eat bowl because it makes it easier to experiment. If you don't like the first bowl, make another.   The iced tea is freshly brewed and really good, and they have Coke Zero. I also love that there are lots of protein choices (marinated steak, chicken breast, shrimp, turkey, and more) and you can choose a starch (tortillas, noodles, rice) or just have none at all (I usually have no starch).   It's an easy place to get full for under $30 for two. I've noticed the crowds have died down significantly since the place opened. It used to be packed and you had to wait to eat but now you can walk in pretty much any time of the day. A decent place to go and one that I'll continue to visit.

I was really excited about this place because they don't start off with frozen meats like YC's does...unfortunately I've had better experience with YC's. I didn't really like the fact that I handed off my food and sat down because I'm pretty sure they poured another sauces on mine! I went with everything sweet and ended up with such a spicy meal that I had to stop eating it!! Big problem! It was nice that they give discounts to ASU students though. Not sure I want to go back and be disappointed...but we shall see, I am quite the forgiving person! Everyone makes mistakes! Just wish it weren't ALWAYS with my meals!
Great food! I've been to many Mongolian grills, including YC's, and this place is the bee's knees! Very user-friendly, great drinks, and friendly staff.

Nothing all that spectacular in my opinion. Marinated beef was chewy and I ended up picking out most of it. Sauces tasted a little bland after cooking. Dinner bowl is $9.99 which is a little pricey considering the choices and portions. I'd rather pay a little more and go to Kabuto Japanese Steak house where the food is cooked in front of you with some added entertainment provided by the cook. Good thing I had a coupon so I was able to shave a little off the total. I think one visit is good enough for me.
The food was excellent. They just need to have more locations. I live in N. Las Vegas.

Officially a fan. I wasn't able to review the place fully because I hadn't tried the food yet, but last night I made a delish mix at Genghis.  Marinated steak chased by a few seasonings, and that yummy teriyaki, dragon, and asian sauces with Udon noodles...I think I'm drooling writing about this right now. It was seriously soo good and fresh nothing frozen.   My buddy and I sat at the bar watched the game, enjoyed great food with good convo and sipped out countless mimosa's. Definitely a great way to spend a Sunday.

The short of it: I'm not sure I would pay regular price here too often, but I always enjoy my free birthday bowl immensely. And it's gotten better the more I've learned to add enough salt and spices.  This is the only Genghis Grill which I've been to, and other than that, I haven't really had too much so-called Mongolian barbecue aside from mall food courts. The premise is that you can pick your own meats, starch, and flavors and have them cook it on a giant hot metal flattop.  The routine starts as follows: you're seated, a server asks you if you want appetizers or alcohol / bar seating (both of which I've never bothered with), and then you go to the line to choose your food. If you're lucky, there won't be much of a line and you'll get more time to weigh your options. If not, then think on your feet. As others have said, it's your own damn fault if you don't get a flavorful dish.  An employee will ask you if you want a small, medium, or large bowl. I thought I could have eaten a little more after the medium. You get to pick from a variety of proteins, spices and seasonings, and sauces. Definitely load your main bowl at least to the rim with proteins. I would stick to the ones that have recognizable meat texture, which for me were the marinated steak tips, pork, and marinated white fish. The chicken looked unappetizing and there was no way I was using the processed meats. Further down the line are various vegetables that you might also consider adding. I wouldn't add too many aside from mushrooms, onions, and maybe carrots since I'm all about meat.  The next two steps are so important that they get their own paragraph. You need to add spices and seasonings because there won't be enough from the meats, starches, or even the sauces.
