The flavors were again wonderful and of course even better since I got everything I wanted this time. The wait staff were friendly and attentive, although maybe a quick run down of the ordering process would make it less awkward for those who haven't been there before. Also, try the Coconut Honey Fizz, it goes great with a spicy bowl. A few thoughts on the process, nothing to the restaurant itself. A menu with the choices that you can look or maybe even fill out before going to the line would be helpful so your not standing there trying to make a choice and holding up the other diners. It would also be nice if the vegetables were first then the protein; only because veg tend to take up a lot of space in the bowl but then cook down significantly and it would be easier to stack meat on top of them and still get a decent amount of each.  I'll go back again, but definitely sticking with making my own bowl instead of online ordering.

Super poor attitude by supervisor. The wait staff (2 of them) told me to go to the bar and pay for the food since it was to go. When I proceeded to the bar the manager MEMO proceeds to get loud and ask me to leave the bar area, as if he wanted to be confrontational. Dude needs to calm down and take his minimum wage attitude down. Food was ok for the price but he killed my experience for sure. Won't be returning or telling anyone.
Terrible service. Drinks were never served, I got my food but the person I went with never got theirs so we left. Absolute mad house. I will never go there again.

This is just an updated review.  My previous review still stands and the stars remain unchanged.    I have been back twice since my first review, and I will say that as long as you stay away from the rice, it's good.  I had the noodles the last two times and have been fairly pleased.  I'm still unimpressed with the contortion that needs to be done to reach ingredients in the back row, and the staff remains fairly uninterested and/or too casual.    I ordered a watermelon lemonade on my last trip and it was foul.  Didn't have any taste of watermelon, and through that nasty flavor I could hardly taste the lemonade.  It tasted medicinal.  I couldn't get through a fourth of it.  I'll likely be back, but staying with the safe choices of noodles and soda.

Good just to surf your stomach with something which is fresh cooked.....  BEWARE this isn't a make yourself Mongolian restaurant you just select your dish and then get a pre mixed small portion of that in a plastic boxes. The sauces were a bit extra in the dish.
Good food. Only complaint I had was that the waitress never refilled our drinks. Major botheration for me.

My My...There are some serious haters of this place. I'm glad that I didn't read Yelp before going. I actually went because two people in my office raved about it. I went there on two different occasions to buy gift cards for birthdays. I finally decided to go with friends. I've only been to one other Mongolian grill place so there isn't a lot to compare. All that I can say is that the service was mediocre and not terrible. The food was good. I like the concept of making your own meal with ingredients that you like.  My partner didn't follow instructions and put the sauce in his food bowl instead of the side bowl. They made him go back and put more sauce in the side bowl. Ultimately what happened was an inedible bowl. None of us can figure out why they made him add more sauce. It was too much sauce and not good. Three of us; however, enjoyed our meal. I didn't know that this place is a chain. Oh well...I'll go back because I enjoyed it. I'm not sure that my partner will though. The idea of the sauce makes him queasy,

My first impression wasn't very good.  I have been to many of the mongolian grills before and find they use frozen meats both killing taste and making your bowl look full but really on the thin side as the meat doesn't bend to make room in the bowl.  The restaurant atmosphere is essentially a cafeteria, not designed for comfort but rather to cram as many people into the restaurant as possible.  The concept is fun and my daughter loved it.  Grab your bowl and get in line, as you progress you choose your protien from shrimp, scallops, pork, chicken, beef, sausage, pepperoni, etc.  Then your spice including salt and pepper, cajun, etc.  You can mix spices. Then your veggies and there is a wide selection.  Finally your sauce, again you can mix and they even recommend some mixing.  They have sweet sauces for the kids and spicy ones for the adult kids :)    Then it is off to the cooking station to pick your starch from various rice and noodle options and then watch them stir fry your meal on the round grill.  I have to say the food was excellent.  The ingredients were fresh and not frozen, the flavor was great and the sauces were tasty.  The best thing is it is a bottomless bowl for an extra 2.95 (free for kids) so you can eat as much as you want.  We will be back soon!

It has been years since we visited Genghis Grill at a different location. Staff greeted us warmly and our server explained the changes since our last visit. He recommended a medium-sized bowl, describing it as the most popular size. Hubby and I had eyes that were larger than our bellies and chose large bowls. He explained how to build our bowls. At the end when I was selecting my rice, the sever suggested I go back and pack my bowl a little more to my surprise. There are lots of toppings to choose from... meats, veggies, sauces, etc. Our bowls arrived at our table quickly and they were delicious. We had to stuff ourselves to hold it all! A medium definitely would have sufficed. Oh and make sure to ask for shrimp sauce if you like it. The servers will bring it to you.   Great experience and can't wait to take our kiddos back!
This place is super yummy! I love coming here with my family. I would recommend this place to anyone!

I have always been obsessed with Genghis. I have been getting the exact same bowl for years... It just never gets old. The great thing about this place is you get to customize your own stir fry! Meat, veggies, spices and sauces! If you like a spicy sweet sauce, do two full cups of soy, and a cup half garlic water and half khazu sauce. You can't beat it. I use that on chicken spiced with dragon salt and Cajun. Spinach, onions, bell pepper, broccoli, mushrooms, carrots, pineapple... It's addicting.  Generally, service is great. I've only had one problem with this place. The last time I came here, I got food poisoning. I was so sad and contacted Genghis to let them know the situation. They handled it nicely and offered me drinks, entree, app, and dessert on them, but I moved. I probably wouldn't have used it anyway since that's not how I roll. Obviously they valued me as a customer though, so that is nice in itself! I would go back here someday even though I died that one time from FP. That is how much I love this place.   Also, Genghis is way better than YC's. Yep, I said it.

I've had better than Genghis Grill.  Why is mongolian BBQ difficult to find these days?  I can't find one in my neighborhood and someone told me to try Genghis Grill out. Since I was going to be in Tempe, I figured WHY NOT?!  Genghis Grill is  not my thing.   We got seated and handed a small metal bowl, I was confused.  At the other mongolian places I have been, you start out with a big bowl not this dinky bowl.  So, I say "whatever, fatty" in my head and head over to the start line to get this meal going.  What do I see?  Nothing but the sickest thing I have seen in a long time.  A BIG-ASS BOWL of BLOODY MEAT, just sitting there in a bowl of blood.  I've never wanted to be a vegetarian so badly in my life.  I suppose I was used to YC's where the meat is frozen and shaved.   I don't like actually seeing the blood of a meat product, it really grosses me out.    Anyhow, the bowl didn't fit nearly as much food as other places, I guess it's good I didn't over -stuff myself but the price was higher and that whole  meat product area was really bad.  Oh and the scallops, I think they were scallops?  Anyhow it was like a bowl of white fluff (you know marshmallow fluff? in a far?) No real shape to them.    So this whole "fresh" meat, chicken area is one of the grossest things I have seen in a long time.   I must say that after it was all cooked and brought to the table it was more than enough food and it tasted okay, not what I was expecting.

When my husband and I first moved to the Phoenix area we would go to one close to us, but it closed.  We have since gone out of our way to go to this one, and never regretted it.  The staff is wonderful.  We hadn't been in for several months, but when we went in the other day the waiter remembered us.    If you have questions or you need help they are always willing to help.    I love the fact they take allergies into consideration as well.  As then I don't have to avoid bringing family or friends that I know have nut or shellfish allergies.

I love this place, perhaps more than YC's. The food is fresh & the selection of fresh veggies is awesome. One thing those-those little bowls they give you aren't cutting it! I tend to overload on veggies and find myself making a mess & then I feel bad, like I'm the jerk the workers have to clean up after lol. I never get the same thing every time..its like an adventure! Haha. The Khanzu (I think that's what its called) sauce is the best sauce I've tried so far. I liked that you get so many choices for your starch, some are more interesting than others (spiral pasta? tortillas?).. I'll just take the brown rice please! And pass the Sriracha!   I love this place so much I ate there twice last week...or maybe its because I live like 2 minutes away & my roommate had never been. Either or, still a great place, highly recommended!!

Always a tasty meal, I love that I make my own flavor combinations and have as little or as much as I want of a variety of things.  Gave the hubby white rice when he asked for brown, nice waitress was happy to get him on the side.   I think it's our third visit and wish there was one a little closer to the house and we would definately eat here more often,

I'm on the fence about this place. It was slow when we went in, so service was overly efficient -- he was around all the time -- and quick. Everything was plenty tasty, from the chicken pot stickers to the chicken stir fry.  What I don't like about places like this is serving myself. You stand in a line, fill up your bowl with your toppings -- including raw meat -- and let them cook it for you. When the check came, it was $75 for four people to eat and share an appetizer and a dessert. Plus we had to do some of the work! I'd go for a quick bite to eat for lunch or something, but probably wouldn't go back again if I was looking for a nice dinner with table service. It's a little too pricey for what you get.

I eat at boofays all the time, so believe it or not my problem isn't with allowing patrons to handle their own serving utensils and potentially cross-contaminate food allergens or bacteria.  My problem at Ghenghish Ghrihll (where the heck do you put the "H" again?!?) is with the way the staff handles their meat. Sounds pretty yucky, and it is.  After going through a useless ordering procedure instruction by the server, the complications of which are rivaled only by the ridiculous ChinoBandido http://www.yelp.com/biz/chino-bandido-phoenix-3#hrid:Rc5orUUva9KTB4kMp7EgMw , I winced as i grabbed a serving tong laying on top of a pile of raw meat, dished out my portion, and went on touching other serving utensils on the veggies and spices and sauces. GROSS.  Guessed about what to put on the dang thing, and was scared, really, since the server warned to be sure to know you like what you put on by tasting it with a tiny spoon ( from a bowl where it was touched by all those other peoples' grubby germ-laden meat-tongs-hands) .  GROSS.   Thinking that "well, at least it's going to be cooked now," I hand my dish of e-coli-laden vegetables and warm grey meat chunks to the ''chef'' and scurry into the restroom to wash my hands with soap.   When the food finally comes (long wait) to our table in the overly cramped dining room, the portion is onderwhelming and the thing is ugly.  The veggies are overcooked, and when i try the meat chunks, they are undercooked to the point of being rubbery instead of flaking apart as i chew. GROSS.  I will admit i got lucky and concocted a decent flavor, but it was a total fluke.  Unimportant.    I was counting on that warm, grey, pile of exposed-to-the-public meat being cooked through and through to eliminate any food borne bacteria sure to be lingering around after its recent history of unhealthy handling.  The server was more than happy to allow me to fill another bowl, and the guys said i could have them start cooking the meat first and add veggies later , but why should i have to ask for that?    Well, it didn't matter, because i never got the chance to even have them cook up that second bowl.  As i stared down at the sloppy serving station, trying to decide if thinly sliced meat meant more or less chance of bacteria, I watch a staff member fill up the raw chicken tray with more rubbery chunks.  He does not place the new container in the server and pour the old meat on top of it, but instead simply pours new, frozen meat on top of the old thawed meat already in the bin.  This is not only against common sense, but against food handling procedure.    Who knows how many times he refilled this way that day, or how long the meat down in the bottom of that container had been sitting there?!?   GROSS.  If asked whether I prefer to allow all of that sort of thing to just go on behind the closed doors of a kitchen where i can't see it - YES, that's exactly what I prefer.

I've never posted to yelp, but I just love this place. The servers are very sweet and helpful...even to recommending a marvelous tasting drink (Peach Paloma).  I had one friend that had a negative experience, but everyone gets to make one mistake and mine have all been amazing. The lunch bar is less extensive, but still plenty for the most discerning appetite. Evenings and weekends; let go and enjoy!!

I was looking to go to YCs and ended up here by accident instead. Decided to stay and try it and definetly didnt regret it. Cost a little bit more than YCs but its so much better. A lot more variety of meats, veggies, and sauces, and they also have spices which YCs doesnt.

My family and I go to Genghis Grill a couple of times a year and we always have a good experience. The service is good, the food is fresh and delicious, and I love that you can customize your meal to make it as healthy or delicious ;) as you like. The only reason I didn't give it five stars is that: 1. It is kind of pricey in my opinion,  2. The kids menu is just sad, and  3. they got rid of my favorite citrus sauce BOOHOO :(  Other than that it's a great place.

It's a little more pricey than I like for lunch, but good stuff overall.  They do a good job.  You hear lot's of comparisons to YC's and, while this is the same concept, this place has more/better things to put in your mix.

This place gets a lot of flack for portions but I really don't see it. I'm a big guy, I can put food away with the best of them, and a large bowl was more than enough for me! Learn to pack the bowls guys and you can very easily get your money's worth! Riane, my server, was that sweet spot of attentive and, very kind. The cook Christian easily listened when I said I had a mushroom allergy, and after he heard that, He then proceeded to scrub the grill spotless for me. Thank you to the staff and manager Bill for making this dining experience top notch. Alcohol is available, and the tea I drank was fresh and pleasantly flavored.  The bathrooms were warm and clean, the whole place is inviting, come here soon!  P.S.- Dont forget to try the chicken lettuce raps they are a meal in themselves and very delicious!

Wow. Just wow.  Me and a work buddy were looking for something new for Friday lunch and were wanting something bistro/hibachi/mongolian-esque. So we settled on this based on reviews and the three of us wanted something spicy.  We knew it was a build your own bowl place but had no idea what to expect.  When we got there we noticed it had a hipster vibe and looked generic, but trust me, that is just there to draw in more audiences. The waiter was super friendly and explained to us the bowl sizes. We all opted for the large.  When you get up to the bar, the choices are a little overwhelming. I'm going to tell  you now. Don't worry about satisfying palette combinations as it all comes out meshing well together in the end despite your preconceived notions about stir fry.   The first time we went in order and it is a bit hard to get a good amount of veggie combos on top of the meat.  The second time I learned you can do veggies first which it is much easier to stack the comparable slimy meats together.  You can literally stack as high as possible( the serving dish is easily 5 times the volume). You can even arrange broccoli to expand the walls of your bowl to make it hold more.  Be wary of the spices and sauces and the first trip me and my buddies were literally sweating.  The bowls are a lot of food even without proper stacking techniques.   They even let you take home extras.  The only downside is shrimp costs extra but you can make a fire dish after a couple of trips.   It's amazing and great for the family.   Definitely recommend.

This place is okay for a Mongolian grill. I advise doing your own to get better value.  I think the pre-made meals aren't as much meat but maybe I'm wrong. I got all meat and veggies with no rice and it was pretty good. I think I have a coupon so I'll be back.

I went to this place for lunch today with a friend. It was really nothing that I would run back for. I think the goodness level kind of depends on you, as you add the ingredients, including seasonings, sauces, veggies, meat, and starch. I think the instructions could be more clearly displayed. First you see meat, then you come upon dry spices.... I thought this was going to be the only flavor source for the food, so I used too much.... if I go again (big if) I would choose maybe just ginger or something. I used a bunch of garlic, only to find fresh garlic later down the line. Curses!   They do have a good selection of veggies that seem fairly fresh. The meat is real cut up meat, not that weird freeze dried meat that is used at some of these places. I thought their choice of noodle is a bit weird... udon.... kind of thick and slimy... I would have picked like soba noodles or rice noodles or something. That wasn't a huge issue, but just something I thought was weird. I had them put the chili garlic sauce mixed with kung pao mixed with a hint of peanut sauce... turned out fairly good.   Also, it is a bit pricey, especially when you only get to go up once, so you can only make one sauce decision.... if you screw up, you're kind of screwed. Also, other places allow you to get soup and rice or something with the entree.... that would be nice considering what they charge. If someone suggested it again, I would go, but I wouldn't go back on my own.

At first we lived this place but we've been back and out most recent trip we received awful service. We were seated and no one came over for at least 10 minutes. We flagged down another waitress who said she'd tell our server to come over. We waited for another 5 minutes and she didn't apologize and didn't address the issue at all. The food wasn't as good as it was before and they meat offerings changed and we more limited.

I'll never eat Y.C.'s again.  Not that Y.C.'s Mongolian BBQ is awful (although it kinda is), it's just that Genghi's does the whole build-your-own-stir-fry thing so much better, with fresher ingredients, that I don't see the point in lowering my standards for any other comp.  I'm glad I don't live closer to one of Genghi's Valley locations because I'd end up eating there more often that I'd like to admit.  My favorite concotion involves bean sprouts, beef, water chestnuts, lots of bell peppers, baby corn, two eggs, and dragon sauce over brown rice. It's just perfect.

I really wanted to love this place but I cant. YC's is a much better deal.  Smaller portions, higher prices, drinks not included, no extras like soup and frozen yogurt and a server that you need to tip for not doing much of anything. Bleh  If I'm going to stand in line and create my own meal, let me wait for it and carry it to my table so I don't feel obligated to tip.  Nice selection of meats and noodles, sauces and spices - but I would never choose this place over YC's. Tried it 3 x's and just don't like it. They do serve alcohol here so that is a plus.

I've been to many mongolian bbq places all over the country but this was not mongolian bbq. It tasted like a poor excuse for a fajita. None of the "sauces" had the right flavor and even the suggested combinations were terrible. I do not recommend this place to anyone. Especially if you have ever had real mongolian bbq. It was a real disappointment.

I was skeptical when my friend was telling me about this place at first. But we went and it was SO good! I LOVE stirfry to begin with but this place is just awesome. You get sooo much food if you get the medium. I have a whole extra meal!

This place is delicious, I love how you can put your meal together to your liking . The staff was helpful and friendly , place was clean and the food was delicious. We didn't have to wait long for the food and it was hot and ready in a to go box. Five stars !!!!!

My husband I came in to order food to go and the girl at the front desk asked us if we'd like her to watch our little one while we built our bowls! She definitely didn't have to do that, but she went above and beyond! P.S my daughter loved her and it was a  really great experience when it could have been stressful trying to chase our daughter while making our food;) I didn't catch her name but she had long red hair and tattoos! Thank you ;)

This place is AWESOME!  Best value that $ can buy. There are so many options of meats, veggies, sauces, & starches to chose from. Manager "Rob" is the coolest dude on earth. He always makes sure you are taken care of. You can't go wrong here because you are the one who determines what you want and you actually are the one making it.   Eat here folks!
Get the Thai Chicken or Beef Broccoli. The food is always fresh and the service is excellent!

Starving in the Charlotte Airport while waiting for a connection, I ordered the Thai Bowl which was little more than frozen vegetables and chunks of dry chicken with a bland curry-peanut sauce. Not the worst airport food I have ever eaten but definitely room for improvement, especially because each bowl Is $11 without drink included. Next time I will try the BBQ joint next door!

As far as Airport cuisine, this place wasn't bad. I got the chicken with stir-fried rice and aside from being $10+ and portioned on the smaller side, the flavors were balanced and the dish was well done. Nothing in particular about the food here stands out, but it filled a void in my belly.   Worthy of noting, if I wasn't starving my money would be way better spent at just about any chinese take out joint, but being in an airport the value ilfor your buck is to be expected. Kind of like popcorn at the movies I suppose! In my honest opinion, the dish I ordered should have been about $6 and not $10+ so for that I give this place a weak three stars.

I went here for lunch one day and was expecting a lot more. My waitress barely waited on me and kept giving me nasty looks. I thought maybe it was because she may have been hormonal (she was in her 3rd trimester), but she smiled at other tables and as soon as she came to mine, I kept getting the same nasty look. She stopped at every table but only zipped past mine. It couldn't have been because the hostess sat me at a further table. She sat me there herself. She asked me if everything was good and before I could even say anything she was already off somewhere else. It was as if she was pretending to serve me. The guy who brought me my bowl asked if I wanted Sriracha or soy sauce and I asked if I could have both. He walks off and passes by my table. I wait again for him to pass and nothing. He passes by a third time and goes to the hostess area and gets on his Facebook. The table they sat me at was wet when I sat down. I had to use the one napkin they gave me to wipe it off. I don't know what was wrong. It was as if they were in a hurry. There was no rush. It was about three in afternoon and there were only two other tables. The amount of staff outnumbered the amount of guests. The bowl they gave me had some dried food on it. I had to ask for another one. When it came time to pay the bill was a little under 20 dollars so I left a 20 and just walked out. Smallest tip I have ever left in my life. I pay 15% even for mediocre service, but this level of WTF, idk, they should have paid me to endure that.

Yuck. YC's is SO much better! I mean, who knows how "fresh" that raw meat really is. This was my first visit and I won't be back. It took 30 minutes for 1 reg bowl take-out and the place was Empty. Not impressed. Save your $15 bucks.

A typical Mongolian BBQ place.  Nothing incredibly special but nothing terrible.  The only memorable part of our dinner was the company.  Compared to the place back home, it wasn't as good (and I didn't think that much of that place already).  Regardless, it was a decent--and cheaper than most places on the strip--place to fill our tummies before a night of drinking back on the strip.

I love Mongolian BBQ. No, you don't understand. This is a thing for me. I was working in the DC area for a few months a couple of years ago and every week, we had to go to BD's or someone would go into withdrawal. Usually me. There's just something about a stir fry where you pick your own fixings and spices and they grill it right then and there.  Everything here is very fresh and a good selection of proteins and veggies and stuff to mix in. Plus a dozen powdered spices and another dozen sauces.  There's no complaining - everything in the bowl was selected by you. So if you're wondering where that chicken or crabmeat came from, look in the mirror!  Service is quick, even when it's busy. Drop off your dish, get a number and the server brings it to your table. Easy, pleasy, lemon squeezy. Yes, there is lemon juice too!

Lots of choices for food in the Charlotte airport these days. Genghis Grill is similar to their full size restaurant format, except that instead of building your own bowl you get one of their premade bowls. I assume that you can add or remove any ingredients, but I went with the Firecracker Shrimp as it comes.  A good amount of shrimp with bean sprouts, onions and peppers. And a lot of spice. This was HOT. Lots of hot pepper and their "dragon sauce" on it. And that's a good thing as it was tasty and filling and it took me a good 15 minutes to eat.  Probably not the kind of food you want to eat on the plane. There are many tables here in the atrium area where you can get some sunshine and watch the folks coming through TSA security.  By far, one of the better choices in CLT for a meal.
My server Ashley was amazing! She recommended us a variety of drinks that we to die for... by far she made our experience great and we will be back!

Ended up going here with friends because YC's had already closed for the night. Portions were tiny, especially for the price. The "small" build-your-own bowl was really tiny, not even close to being enough for a sizeable meal. For the same price at YC's, you get way more for your money. That being said, food was fresh and the sauce selection was pretty good. Our server Michael was awesome! Michael was the real MVP.

awesome service, hands down. i really did love genghis until the whole menu change and switcharoo crap that they just integrated, My wife was really disappointed they took away some of her fav veggies. all the sauces are still the same, you can now choose from 3 different bowl sizes instead of getting just 1. everything tasted really good! there's really not much to complain about except the change. But I do like it here, and frequent often.

Always love this place! the management always hooks us up if something goes wrong, or if everything's not perfect! good service, great food you can pick out to your likings. YUM. good quick eat and go place.

This is a good option from the other places at the airport. I was attracted to this place because it seemed really healthy and fresh. I got the chicken teriyaki with udon. It was ok. I did not expect it to be as sweet as it was. There were too many pineapples which I didn't expect at all. The noodles were fine and the chicken was ok. It was a bit bland but satisfactory. It definitely tasted healthy. It's fairly priced comparatively. You can get your food in less than 10 minutes which is great if you are in a rush.

This is by far the best restaurant in town! Went last week and have already been 2 more times! You can pick what you want in your bowl, stack it as high as you can. I love, love this place. Before I even leave I'm thinking about when I'm coming back! We get a big bowl, and it left over next day.

I love the concept of genghis grill, and after messing up at YC's with too much sauce and seasoning, I was very careful. I really like how the protein is fresh, not frozen, and they have many different options. I mainly stuck with chicken and steak, and really piled on the veggies. Lots of options! I also added noodles/rice and sauce and seasonings before lettin it sizzle while I went back to table to have my drink already there. (Great happy hour specials) When my food came it was a huuge portion!! It was absolute perfection! Also scored points for the sriracha:). Plenty of leftovers, and one happy girl means I will be back:)

First time going to Genghis Grill and it was excellent!   I give all credit to the server John, he made the experience enjoyable. Perfect explanation of the concept and was friendly.  Great food, great service and a great place.

I moved here from SF in June and found an ad for this place in the mail once.  It talked about these fresh drinks and delicious Mongolian food.  I've had Mongolian BBQ before and have always been a fan.  I thought I'd give this place a try.  I love this place because you can pile in as much food as you possibly can into this bowl.  I got the shredded beef and piled it inside the entire bowl.  Usually people like to put all of the meat in the bowl.  I smushed it into the bowl and created a meat bowl within a bowl to put in chicken pieces.  Then there are the spices.  Put everything in that, then came the vegetables.  Use every vegetable you can find.  And then come the sauces.  Make sure you get more than one cup if you want to optimize your experience.  Use every sauce you can think of.  They cook it for your and you're ready to feast like the great Genghis Khan used to after murdering thousands of people.  YAAAAAA!!!!!!!!

I love this place.  It allows me to get great quality and healthy food at a cost of only $10.99 per bowl.  The service is still getting up to par but it doesn't out weigh the food or the experience.  I wouled highly recommend.  I did find seating kinda cramped.
The service was amazing! Food is really delicious and creative. So many different combinations that are all your own. Perfect for meat lovers and vegetarians.

Better taste and quality then Yc's. However, way over priced and tiny tiny portions. I was seriously confused when I was handed a tiny bowl to put my food it. I wasn't very good at stuffing all the ingredients I wanted into the bowl, but I figured the noodles i requested with it would be more than enough. I ordered it to go, couldn't believe it was $10...got home and realized my to go box was less than 1/4 full. I seriously have the smallest appetite, and 9/10 times have left overs with every meal. I ate my entire to go box, and was still starving. While the food tasted good, it definately wasn't worth $10.  Oh, and it was super super confusing. One needs to pop a xanax before visiting this place.

Love this place. Best sauce I have ever had.  I really like this style of dining and this place does a great job. I have never had such flavorful sauce choices at any Mongolian grill ever. When they bring the food out the smell is just divine. I have been twice and both times I was super happy. Little bit pricey, but well worth it to me.

Update:  The manager contacted me to make amends. I'll give the place another shot and will write my review afterward based on that visit. In the meantime, I'll raise their star rating based on the manger's outreach and offer.  Original review:  All it takes, sometimes, is a smart-a** belligerent assistant manager who likes to attempt condescending remarks more than he likes correcting problems to mess up an otherwise good experience. I hope his attitude does not reflect accurately the restaurant's attitude. It's usually a good experience. It's worth a roll of the dice to see if your experience is better than my last one.

My whole experience was nice. I love the selection of meat and spices and veggies they have it's like a feast for the eyes! The portion, when combined with noodles or rice, was good for two people! I think I paid about $10 and the bowl was overloaded I took some home. Next time I'll try having it with rice instead of noodles.
Very good resturant, my husbnad and i always go there. Very good customer serv. And the food is deli.
Just witnessed employee walk out of restroom and didn't wash his hands.  Disgusting. Couldn't eat there.

Decided to skip the BBQ next door today and try the stir fry. If there's a line, it's definitely not as fast so be wary of your time. I went with the Chicken Teriyaki which comes with an assortment of veggies and your choice of white rice, brown rice, noodles, or udon. I'm a sucker for udon so I chose that. The noodles weren't a s thick and chewy as traditional style ones I've had so I'd maybe try the chicken fried rice option next time. For the money, you get tons of food. I couldn't even come close to finishing it. Everything's cooked to order too so its piping hot when you get it. You could easily take this to go because it comes in a resealable tupperware style container, but the smell would be pretty potent if you were to take it on the plane.
Love this place,  finally a place I can get as much meat as I want,  with no useless fillers...   Nothing else to say...    Lots and lots of meat..  Yummy

They are yummy. Typical Mongolian BBQ style. Get your bowl, load it up, they cook it, you eat it. Bowls seem a bit small, but if you're getting all-you-can-eat that really doesn't matter. Plus when you throw in a starch it ends up being plenty of food. Service is fast, even when they are super busy. Which seems to be all the time! I like them, but since they are in Tempe I don't get there often. That could be a good thing for my wallet, and my waist.

Pros: -good selection of veggies, meats, and other items to put in your stir fry -staff was friendly when they messed up my order (they made it w/ rice instead of udon noodles) -the sirloin tip was tasty -I like the Dragon sauce -the dining area was clean and comfortable  Cons: -the stuff in the back row of the assembly line is hard to reach, at least for me. and I don't think my arms are unusually short. -you don't get a TON of food for your money, like at YC's; disclaimer: I haven't been to YCs for about 5 years so I don't know how expensive they are now. for $11.69 (including tip) I got a small bowl with udon noodles that filled me up, but just barely if you know what I mean. I was hungry again 2.5 hours later. -like other reviewers said, handles for the sauce ladles are sticky and stuff  overall, I like the healthy aspect to this place and it's a great place for vegetarians since there are so many veggies and tofu to add to your stir fry.

Yum! This place is convenient because it's close to my house and it's also very good. You basically pick all the meat, veggies, and sauce you like and bring it over to get cooked. Food usually comes out fairly quickly. For the starch items, I like to do a combo of half fried rice and half udon noodles. It's usually more than enough food for me. Good stuff!

This place definitely exceeded my expectations. At first I was expecting more of a "quick service restaurant" type of experience, but it was much more casual dining which I appreciated. From start to finish, the service was good. And the food was amazing. I definitely suggest dining here for those of you looking for a delicious meal especially if you're looking for a more "casual" experience versus a quick one. Plus they have a bar! Can't forget to mention that!
The service here was amazing. ASHLEY. Was great she made sure we were taken care of and fixed anything that went wrong. I would recommend this place to everyone because of her

Really like this place - a variety of meats, seasonings, veggies, sauces, and starches to choose from.  The 3G sauce is my favorite.  Always delicious and satisfying.  The first time I went they really encouraged me to pack my bowl down with stuff to get as much as possible.

I do love me some Mongolian BBQ! It was the best night at the chow hall in Iraq. With that said, I have had better than here. Dont get me wrong they have a wonderful selection especially sauces. I just felt like my rice wasent cooked well. To me this is just simply basic. I may or may not go back. This is not the only place for this type of food.  I do want to point out the service is great! Everyone that works there is really nice. Just wish there were more to this place.

I have been here a few times and have never had an issue, but tonight I was less then impressed. My son added bacon to his bowl and luckily he only took one small bite since it was pretty much raw. Aside from raw bacon everything else was alright and they did let him remake his bowl to go. Aaron was our server tonight and was great.

They no longer have steak which is a bummer, the shaved beef just isn't the same.  It was still yummy though.  This location I've noticed they particularly like to pack people in like sardines and never have enough wait staff.  The servers are always really nice and try their best but they are just really overworked. So if you go to this one be prepared to have to ask for every refill, they will forget things, you'll have to wave your server down if you want anything, but the food is good and the servers are always nice and accomadating.
Nice to see the parking lot full and the good ratings. Looking forward to trying it again in the future.

I grew up in Michigan and one of my favorite Mongolian stir fry places anywhere was within driving distance. Unfortunately, they are not in Phoenix. And since moving here I've been looking for another place to get my fix.  Genghis Grill is the best I've found yet in the valley. Not quite a perfect replacement but I certainly think it is pretty good. Choosing your starch was a nice touch. Not everyone feels like rice.  I feel like some of the sauces are pretty bland but it does give you the ability to experiment. Also there are options on the menu for kids that may not be into stir fry.  The only complication we had for service is that we both went to build our plates. While gone, our table was bussed. Having some sort of card that says someone is at this table may deal with that possible confusion. Also if you decide you want more than 1 bowl, having to wait for wait staff can be frustrating. I understand that it makes it easier to figure out who got 1 bowl vs all you can eat. But when the place is busy, you may be there a while if you want seconds or (somehow) thirds.

Good food, it's like a subway but for Asian food. One of the greatest things about subway is your ability to indulge exclusively to the level of your dietary comfort, Ghengis Grill accomplishes the same feat.  Where it goes one step further is by giving you literally. Ever. Option. Under. The. Sun. You can build a bowl comprised of a gigantic plethora of vegetables and beans; any assortment or amount of seafood, meat, poultry, and tofu (depending on the day); coated in an exponential combination of seasonings and flavors; and seated atop a bed of any common carb source you could want. It's impossible to leave without having eaten what you wanted to eat. The restaurant is fantastic.  The staff is extremely friendly, and truly welcoming. Unfortunately their prices are not; their are deals depending on the day (and your birthday :D) but for a healthy casual place to eat it's terribly overpriced. Additionally, I have seen similar franchises which offer the same experience but with unlimited bowls, for a cheaper price. This restaurant should just commit and make themselves a competitive contender for the average persons choice in a casual meal.   This reviewer suggests you grab a date or fly solo, and explore your palette on a delicious feast.

I enjoy making and watching other people trying to stack pounds of stuff on the bowls trying to get their moneys worth:) the food is always good and service is pretty smooth. the first two times the messed up my rice but were quick to offer to fix it.

As far as this type of restaurant goes I vastly prefer Genghis to YCs. There are a lot of reasons why I prefer this place. One of which is that their meat looks much better then what YCs puts out. Also because it's not frozen there isn't a ton of suspended water content which means that when you get your food back it tastes better and the sauce isn't overly watery. Not to mention there is no freezer burn!  The veggies here almost always look more fresh then what I've come across at YCs. I love my onions and here they are crisp and freshly cut.  The portion sizes are a bit smaller, there is no denying that. But as far as flavor goes this place takes the cake from YCs.

Really great concept. You get to decide on what you want to eat and every time you can make it different. And you always have leftovers! I will always stop in when I'm at tempe marketplace even if I am not eating, I can grab a ice cold beer or one of their yummy drinks on the menu. When you go in I suggest trying the blue dragon and bring a friend so you can get the fishbowl size! It's a perfect instagram photo! #soyummy #nofishies #thegreatestservers

The food was good. It is a bit expensive for what it is. OK, super expensive for what it is. You get your own drinks and prepare your own food... then tip like you're being served everything. The setting is a cross between Cicis Pizza and Panda Express.   The biggest problem is the gross food setup. The chicken tongs had raw chicken all over them, with everyone touching them with their bare hands. Same with all the meat. Then you get the veggies, and other customers touch their raw meat with the veggie tongs, and put the tongs back into the veggies. Totally unsanitary.   We'll see how many bathroom trips we have tonight.

I REALLY, REALLY, REALLY, wanted to like this place. Let's start w the positive. Nice atmosphere, liked the bar and the fact that we could get mixed drinks, great staff! VERY friendly and helpful! Definitely the best looking Mongolian place I've been to. Unfortunately you can not eat all the above! If so it would be a 5 star joint. The food... Well it's hard to explain but it's not Mongolian BBQ. If they'd have left the mongolian out of the name and just called it Genghis Grill Stir fry, maybe I'd feel different. I just expected real Mongolian. I know it's a chain restaurant and you can tell they spent some dough in this place. But how do you screw Mongolian up? It's like these cats way over thought the concept? The meat was not good. The veggies combos were all wrong. And the sauces, which a prob the most important part were to thick! Way to thick. I don't care about the metal bowls and the cooks banging the gong when tipped, all I wanted was some descent Mongolian. What they have is way over done corporate over americanized Stir Fry.  Apparently you can get fajitas though? All you can eat! What a joke!

I had the Thai chicken bowl which was advertised as a red curry. It was probably the worst meal I have ever paid for. There was almost no chicken and no curry - just a mush of nearly unrecognizable vegetables and who knows what else. Stay away.

Seriously absolutely horrible and so over priced!  I will never return to this place!  Tiny bowl for way too much money!  Sauces were horrible, seems like they maybe come from large tubs that are purchased from somewhere like Costco.  The little form they give you says you get to pick two sides with your stir-fry, I asked for my rice on the side.  The rice came in the bottom of the bowl soaked in the horrible sauce they offer!  Save yourself and don't eat here, not worth the money at all!  If you like these type of restaurants go to YCs.  Better meat, bigger bowls for less money, rice on the side, free soup, free ice cream and just an over all better experience!

Not too sure about this place for business lunch. Definitely not the quick stop I was looking for but the food was good. I expect a place built for lunch with the grill set up like YC's to be quick, so people can get in & out during the work week. I waited for a while for my waiter to show up to get my drink order, and there was a long line waiting for food. I made it through and sat back down to wait for it to be cooked, but the whole process took much longer than I was prepared for.  When I finally got my food it was tasty. So, the food is good, and the service isn't horrible, but the processes just aren't built to get you in & out quickly.
Another amazing lunch this time Wendy was our server everything went prefect even the cook boys did perfect  Like I was told Pile up always great deal . Will be back.

Seriously?!?! I don't know if I should attribute the deliciousness to my seasoning  or to them for being so brilliant with the concept and execution?! I wish we had one closer to home. For now I only come here for lunch. It's a casual setting but also good as a dinner spot! I haven't even begun to tap into the many possibilities of the bowls I can create. I'll be coming back! Build it yourself and pack as much into that little bowl as humanely possible!!!!

Of course, it's airport food so nobody expects a lot. It's overpriced but that should be overlooked at any airport. The two bigger issues were the service (they messed up 3 straight orders so took over 15 minutes to get the food) and the fact that the food was exceedingly bland. It wouldn't be too hard for them to make it look nice, add some flavorful sauces, spruce up their fried rice and make this place good, but instead its like a high school cafeteria.

Food was good today! Tried this place when they first opened and it was meh...now much much better!!! They seem to cater to the customer now...very good customer service! Food is fresh and lots of variety...  maybe defrost the coolers so veggies don't stick to the bottim of pans.. now if the young chefs would follow along with the program and get things done instead of chitty chatting then everything would be good!

So far the best experience I've ever had in a restaurant in my entire life. I'm from India and moved to San Francisco in 2009 and I'm visiting family in charlotte. I believe our server name was BILL and he was very nice and polite and friendly. I haven't experienced that in many places. I felt so comfortable and welcoming. And of course the food was awesome I was kind of frustrated with the process but man the food came out great. Thanks for this great experience. You guys need to bring this to San Francisco!! And not to mention the free refills on the drinks and you can choose different drinks as well.

I have now been to Genghis Grill twice. I absolutely love this place!! The service is incredible! EVERYONE there is friendly and professional! Nothing but smiles! The food is delicious! I don't eat beef or pork so I love the different choices of seafood! I will continue to eat here. Thank you Genghis Grill!!!

honestly the food is great at time but me and my buddys just got food poison and it was right after we ate here. We told the person that was grilling for us to cook a little longer but we can tell he was rushing it thats only reason writing the review because i wouldnt want anyone else to get sick like we did just make sure they cook the meat entirely.

This is by far the best place for Mongolian BBQ. I come here every time I'm in town for lunch. Love Tempe Marketplace. It's best if you build your own bowl, but you can use their bowl suggestions.  I like eating the sliced and seasoned beef, the blended seasoning, a dash of cayenne and garlic.  For veggies, I use beansprouts, onions, bell peppers and snow peas. I like blending the sauces (teriyaki, mongo bbq and szechuan). Top off with some fried rice. Good stuff!

My wife and I have been patrons of Genghis Grill for a number of years now and have always found the dining experience to be satisfying and a good value. Until today. We visited after a two or three month absence to find their prices significantly elevated and their customer reward program diminished. We won't be back!

My husband and I stopped in on a busy Saturday night and had such a great experience due to the yummy food, and mostly due to our fantastic waiter Amy! She was so helpful and sweet, and speedy in getting us extra drinks and tortillas, and she would notice ahead of time when we were running low on napkins and drinks before we even asked and would get us more right away! She has been one of the best waitresses we have had at any restaurant we have been to in a while! The manager even walked around and stopped periodically at our table to see if we needed anything, which was a nice touch with it being such a busy night for them. We will definitely be back for the great food, but even more so because of the great service!
First time here and it was awesome! I love how you can create your own dish! Best idea ever! Amazing sauces and wonderful servers.
This place is amazing you get to pick you own everything. So picky or not your going to like it :) will definitely come back soon and often.

Oh how I love this place! I've been too many times to count on my lunch break. The service is always great! Theres not much for them to do though. Aside from refilling your drink and bringing appetizers to your table if you choose to order them. But they are really helpful and friendly. When you walk in, you are seated immediately. You will place your drink orders and grab a card in the center of the table and head to create your bowl.   They do have bowl suggestions. You can grab a card and use it as a reference in creating your bowl. Thats if you want to stay on the safe side. But you can also create your own from start to finish. How it turns out is entirely dependant on you! Don't be afraid to pack your bowl to capacity!! Trust me, you won't be alone. Once you tell them what size bowl you'd like, you 1st select your proteins. They have a wide selection of meats. Some are even marinated. I always pack my bowl with proteins. Its more important than veggies! lol! Next is the seasonings. I prefer to season each of my meats differently, so i'm always back and forth between the sections for each of my proteins. Then you have your veggies. They have just about everything!! I'm always packing in my veggies because i've already filled most of my bowl up with meats. Sometimes there's overflow on my tray but they'll go ahead and cook it as long as it doesn't get out of control. Then you have your sauces. They have tasting spoons at the beginning of the section. Once you start tasting sauces theres so many to choose from and they are all good so its hard to decide. You'll want to add a mix of all but dont do it! Be conscious of how they will combine. It really affects how your bowl will turn out. Make sure to discard your tasting spoon at the end of the station in the trash.   Then you head to the grill where you choose your starch. People don't know this but you can choose 2 starches! I always get Fried Rice & Tortillas. I don't like when my rice is mixed in my bowl so I always get it on the side. They can also cook your rice with an egg. You'll need to let them know this at the grill. They'll then give you a number to place at your table. Theres hand wipes and nuts as well at the grill. I always grab a couple of togo sauce cups and head back to get me a couple sauces to dip and add to my bowl as I eat. Also, if you ask the server they can bring you cheese and sour cream for your tortillas. They cook the bowls really quick so it won't be longer than a 10 minute wait for your bowl and they'll bring it to your table.   Even when my bowl doesn't come out exactly how I like, I just love it anyway. Because its never horrible. Its fun also, to be able to make your own bowl and experiment each time you go to see what works and what doesn't. No complaints with this place.

Love Mongolian BBQ, Love this place.  Everything is always fresh and has the best varitey of any I have been to.  Would have given it 5 stars if they had the traditional sesame and other cool oils....

Let me start by saying that I was pretty hungry when I stopped into Genghis Grill. The concept is similar to other locations in the valley with smaller portions than others I have visited. The staff was super friendly and very helpful but please.... the buffet where you load your food was filthy! Not just spilled food, but dirty bowls to heap your food into and crusty little sauce bowls too. I can't believe the health department hasn't taken a peek at that. The food was fair but I just couldn't get past the mess. Sorry.

I work here at the airport so I have tried most of the restaurants and decided to give Genghis Grill a try. I was sorely disappointed. I ordered the Thai chicken with udon noodles and what I received was some noodles with chunks of frozen veggies and dry pieces of chicken tossed in a very pepper based sauce. Nothing like the described "peanut" sauce on the menu. Was a complete waste of $9, will definitely not be eating here again.

Fun place to eat.  You pick out your protien(s), seasoning, veggies/extras, sauce and noodles/rice and they cook it up and bring it to you.  For just a few bucks more you can make unlimited trips and try a really wide variety of stuff.  They have a rewards program online.

I really didn't think this place was as bad as the reviewers have made it out to be.  That said, I've never been to the YC's that's been mentioned, maybe I'd change my tune if I had.    I've been to lots of Mongolian grills and this seemed right in line with the rest.  I did find it a little strange to have a server, especially since we were about 10 feet from the grill, but it's not a major complaint.  He kept our drinks filled and grabbed some chopsticks for our 4 year old when he overheard that he wanted some.    The food was tasty and seemed fresh.  I happened to like that the sauces were pre-mixed, it took some guesswork out of it.  A lot of places have "recipes" on the wall so you can make certain types of sauces, but if you don't get it right it can ruin the entire bowl.  I liked knowing what I was going to get.    FYI - you choose your carbs (rice, noodles, etc) at the grill instead of in the buffet line.  I was a bit confused when they didn't have any to add to my bowl.  I found this nice as well because I didn't have to pile my bowl as high.

My boyfriend absolutely loves this place he goes at least once a week. I'm definitely a fan as well. You get  A LOT of food for only 10 bucks and its quite tasty. It takes a few times of going to get it right though with the different combinations of sauces and spices.

Me and my bf went to try out their food just because it's close to home and we pleased. The service was excellent and the food was very good. 2 drinks, 2 medium dinners and an appetizer came to $40.00. We were told to pile our food high but  did realize just how how we needed to pile. We  both got Udon noodles as a starch and it somewhat overwhelmed our plate.So when they say "pile high", listen:-) They also have a computer type device on the table which was fun. I will definitely go back!

Just had a horrible experience here. The host was rude, she had to move other employees stuff off a table to clean it but left the table top dirty, we had to retrieve a cloth to wipe the table ourselves. Waking up to the food line there was stuff sprayed up on the wall the ingredient cards were stuck together and the food line it self was absolutely disgusting. We decided to just leave and go somewhere else. Never again.
Aaron is awesome.  Will come back soley to chill at the bar and enjoy his personality
There's only one thing I can say about this place... It sucks.  The food was okay, but it took forever for them to cook it... Not a pleasant experience.

The food was good, the waitress was excellent but the place is FILTHY. Our shoes were sticking to the floor near the food and the area where they were cooking was gross. I don't know why it hasn't been reported.

Amazing concept and food.. If you dont like it, it is pretty much your fault for lack of picking what you like.. Everything down from sauce to dry seasoning to add ons are all your choice.. I loaded up with meats and veggies with fried rice and was stuffed.. Pricey by some standards but its a ton of food, well worth it

I've always liked Mongolian BBQ places, but this is not my favorite chain.   I have been to this location a few times and to one in TX a couple times.  This location is not as good as the one I went to in TX.    They have several fish options included in their base price, which many other Mongolian BBQs exclude.  They have a good house sauce that I like to use on my bowls.  The positives pretty much end there.  First, their whole setup makes it difficult to get to the third row of ingredients.  You have to sort of bend your head below the sneeze guard to get to that back row.  There should only be two rows or the sneeze guard should be raised.  Even those with longer arms than me had difficulty reaching to those ingredients.    On my last lunch visit (this past Sunday), the shrimp had a strong fishy smell.  I took a couple bites of the shrimp and I could not stomach it.    Their fried rice is DISGUSTING.  I have tried a lot of fried rice in my life and, being 1/4 Ilocano, I make my grandfather's recipe.  Of course I am partial to my family recipe, but even when I haven't thought a place's rice was up to par with Papa's, I was still able to eat it.  This rice just tastes like salt.  Blech.    The service was okay on our last visit.  We went without drink refills for most of our meal, but the server remembered our refills around the same time he remembered our check.  He was very helpful once it was time for us to leave.  He even made sure we were signed up with the email club for discounts.    Overall, this is not "on the list."  Would i return again?  Maybe.  I would rather go to YC's or BD's (is there a BD's in AZ?) but, if I was hungry and in the area... I might head in.

I liked the old Ghengis Grill and the current changes that they have made makes you feel like your teacher is looking over your back which makes you feel uncomfortable.   No wonder why the 2 locations in Paradise Valley and Scottsdale shut down.   They have 2 size bowls and then give you a tray to hold your bowl. Use to be able to get as many eggs as possible and now are restricted to 2. Use to be able to get tortillas and now they charge you for them.   I understand why the owners changed things but if you take away things that your loyal customers had don't expect them to come back.  Before this place was a 5 stars, now they are a 3 star.   Don't like the new changes and don't know if i will come back.

They have the raw meat placed before the veggies so the patrons use the veggie tongs to fill their bowls containing raw meat and then the tongs go back into the veggies.  This creates a disgusting cesspool of bacteria on the veggies.  I'm shocked someone hasn't died from dining here.

The selection of meats is diverse and fresh, which is surprising for a Mongolian stir fry restaurant.  You have a choice of the typical fare: steak, pork, salami and crab, but Genghis also offers fresh calamari and shrimp.  You can also add several veggie choices and egg.  Yes, fried egg!  The sauces are all tasty and you can pick up a dish card that gives you paint by numbers ingredient instructions for those that don't want to concoct something on their own.  There are 5 noodle options and the cooks add those after you've given them your bowl of stuff-you don't have to balance your pyramid of noodles as is the case at YC's.    I've never had a bad bowl at Genghis.  In fact their fresh ingredients and friendly waitstaff make this one of my favorite eating spots in the Valley.  Ask your server for cheese and tortillas for your bowl.  If you consider it a challenge to stuff more and more into your bowl every time you go, make a bowl within a bowl with your meat selections.  Add your meat(s), contour the meat around the bowl and then add your other stuff.    They also have excellent daily drink specials, including a half off happy hour on Saturdays from 10PM 'til close.  I recommend getting any of their specialty drinks at that time.  *Tip*  Sign up for their Khan's Reward Card and earn free bowls and get a free bowl on your birthday.

We're in CLT for a few days and got super excited to find this GG. Atlanta had a few but they closed down due to poor service/reputation. We were very happy to find a friendly staff, clean food line and dining area and great food. Just what we were after. We'll be back next time we come through.
Food was awesome with a lot various of protein, veggies, and sauces. The drinks were pretty good, I got the blue dragon which was amazing.

From the minute we stepped inside, the staff seemed very unhappy to be working. This place was near empty. I made a comment about the dirty bowl I was handed and Kelly, if that's her name, said I could grab another bowl from the next table. The cutlery and bowls were not clean. So, since I made one comment, the whole entire staff was informed and I felt uncomfortable. I decided to watch my food being cooked and apparently this is unwelcome as well. Then, surprisingly after the cook dumped my food into the serving bowl, he sneezed into his elbow which unfortunately was near my bowl. I followed the person carrying my bowl. The man said, "Who do you have? Good luck" Wow. Okay.  I couldn't even eat at this point. Sam came to the table because my daughter explained what had happened. Sam is apparently the manager and he made the comment. He apologized and gave me a card for a free bowl next visit. No thanks   This is generic Mongolian BBQ. If you don't mind dirty utensils and bowls, immature staff, cooks that sneeze in your food, and subpar food that costs more than it should then this place won't disappoint. But, if you care about cleanliness please  save yourself the trouble and just go somewhere else if you're hungry. This was a very unpleasant experience.
